2148#ifdef CONFIG_KVM_MMU_AUDIT
2149#include "mmu_audit.c"
2150#else
2151static void kvm_mmu_audit(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu, int point) { }
2152static void mmu_audit_disable(void) { }
2153#endif
2154
2155static bool is_obsolete_sp(struct kvm *kvm, struct kvm_mmu_page *sp)
2156{
2157 return unlikely(sp->mmu_valid_gen != kvm->arch.mmu_valid_gen);
2158}
2159
2160static bool kvm_sync_page(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu, struct kvm_mmu_page *sp,
2161 struct list_head *invalid_list)
2162{
2163 kvm_unlink_unsync_page(vcpu->kvm, sp);
2164 return __kvm_sync_page(vcpu, sp, invalid_list);
2165}
2166
2167/* @gfn should be write-protected at the call site */
2168static bool kvm_sync_pages(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu, gfn_t gfn,
2169 struct list_head *invalid_list)
2170{
2171 struct kvm_mmu_page *s;
2172 bool ret = false;
2173
2174 for_each_gfn_indirect_valid_sp(vcpu->kvm, s, gfn) {
2175 if (!s->unsync)
2176 continue;
2177
2178 WARN_ON(s->role.level != PT_PAGE_TABLE_LEVEL);
2179 ret |= kvm_sync_page(vcpu, s, invalid_list);
2180 }
2181
2182 return ret;
2183}
2184
2185struct mmu_page_path {
2186 struct kvm_mmu_page *parent[PT64_ROOT_MAX_LEVEL];
2187 unsigned int idx[PT64_ROOT_MAX_LEVEL];
2188};
2189
2190#define for_each_sp(pvec, sp, parents, i) \
2191 for (i = mmu_pages_first(&pvec, &parents); \
2192 i < pvec.nr && ({ sp = pvec.page[i].sp; 1;}); \
2193 i = mmu_pages_next(&pvec, &parents, i))
2194
2195static int mmu_pages_next(struct kvm_mmu_pages *pvec,
2196 struct mmu_page_path *parents,
2197 int i)
2198{
2199 int n;
2200
2201 for (n = i+1; n < pvec->nr; n++) {
2202 struct kvm_mmu_page *sp = pvec->page[n].sp;
2203 unsigned idx = pvec->page[n].idx;
2204 int level = sp->role.level;
2205
2206 parents->idx[level-1] = idx;
2207 if (level == PT_PAGE_TABLE_LEVEL)
2208 break;
2209
2210 parents->parent[level-2] = sp;
2211 }
2212
2213 return n;
2214}
2215
2216static int mmu_pages_first(struct kvm_mmu_pages *pvec,
2217 struct mmu_page_path *parents)
2218{
2219 struct kvm_mmu_page *sp;
2220 int level;
2221
2222 if (pvec->nr == 0)
2223 return 0;
2224
2225 WARN_ON(pvec->page[0].idx != INVALID_INDEX);
2226
2227 sp = pvec->page[0].sp;
2228 level = sp->role.level;
2229 WARN_ON(level == PT_PAGE_TABLE_LEVEL);
2230
2231 parents->parent[level-2] = sp;
2232
2233 /* Also set up a sentinel. Further entries in pvec are all
2234 * children of sp, so this element is never overwritten.
2235 */
2236 parents->parent[level-1] = NULL;
2237 return mmu_pages_next(pvec, parents, 0);
2238}
2239
2240static void mmu_pages_clear_parents(struct mmu_page_path *parents)
2241{
2242 struct kvm_mmu_page *sp;
2243 unsigned int level = 0;
2244
2245 do {
2246 unsigned int idx = parents->idx[level];
2247 sp = parents->parent[level];
2248 if (!sp)
2249 return;
2250
2251 WARN_ON(idx == INVALID_INDEX);
2252 clear_unsync_child_bit(sp, idx);
2253 level++;
2254 } while (!sp->unsync_children);
2255}
2256
2257static void mmu_sync_children(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu,
2258 struct kvm_mmu_page *parent)
2259{
2260 int i;
2261 struct kvm_mmu_page *sp;
2262 struct mmu_page_path parents;
2263 struct kvm_mmu_pages pages;
2264 LIST_HEAD(invalid_list);
2265 bool flush = false;
2266
2267 while (mmu_unsync_walk(parent, &pages)) {
2268 bool protected = false;
2269
2270 for_each_sp(pages, sp, parents, i)
2271 protected |= rmap_write_protect(vcpu, sp->gfn);
2272
2273 if (protected) {
2274 kvm_flush_remote_tlbs(vcpu->kvm);
2275 flush = false;
2276 }
2277
2278 for_each_sp(pages, sp, parents, i) {
2279 flush |= kvm_sync_page(vcpu, sp, &invalid_list);
2280 mmu_pages_clear_parents(&parents);
2281 }
2282 if (need_resched() || spin_needbreak(&vcpu->kvm->mmu_lock)) {
2283 kvm_mmu_flush_or_zap(vcpu, &invalid_list, false, flush);
2284 cond_resched_lock(&vcpu->kvm->mmu_lock);
2285 flush = false;
2286 }
2287 }
2288
2289 kvm_mmu_flush_or_zap(vcpu, &invalid_list, false, flush);
2290}
2291
2292static void __clear_sp_write_flooding_count(struct kvm_mmu_page *sp)
2293{
2294 atomic_set(&sp->write_flooding_count, 0);
2295}
2296
2297static void clear_sp_write_flooding_count(u64 *spte)
2298{
2299 struct kvm_mmu_page *sp = page_header(__pa(spte));
2300
2301 __clear_sp_write_flooding_count(sp);
2302}
2303
2304static struct kvm_mmu_page *kvm_mmu_get_page(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu,
2305 gfn_t gfn,
2306 gva_t gaddr,
2307 unsigned level,
2308 int direct,
2309 unsigned access)
2310{
2311 union kvm_mmu_page_role role;
2312 unsigned quadrant;
2313 struct kvm_mmu_page *sp;
2314 bool need_sync = false;
2315 bool flush = false;
2316 int collisions = 0;
2317 LIST_HEAD(invalid_list);
2318
2319 role = vcpu->arch.mmu.base_role;
2320 role.level = level;
2321 role.direct = direct;
2322 if (role.direct)
2323 role.cr4_pae = 0;
2324 role.access = access;
2325 if (!vcpu->arch.mmu.direct_map
2326 && vcpu->arch.mmu.root_level <= PT32_ROOT_LEVEL) {
2327 quadrant = gaddr >> (PAGE_SHIFT + (PT64_PT_BITS * level));
2328 quadrant &= (1 << ((PT32_PT_BITS - PT64_PT_BITS) * level)) - 1;
2329 role.quadrant = quadrant;
2330 }
2331 for_each_valid_sp(vcpu->kvm, sp, gfn) {
2332 if (sp->gfn != gfn) {
2333 collisions++;
2334 continue;
2335 }
2336
2337 if (!need_sync && sp->unsync)
2338 need_sync = true;
2339
2340 if (sp->role.word != role.word)
2341 continue;
2342
2343 if (sp->unsync) {
2344 /* The page is good, but __kvm_sync_page might still end
2345 * up zapping it. If so, break in order to rebuild it.
2346 */
2347 if (!__kvm_sync_page(vcpu, sp, &invalid_list))
2348 break;
2349
2350 WARN_ON(!list_empty(&invalid_list));
2351 kvm_make_request(KVM_REQ_TLB_FLUSH, vcpu);
2352 }
2353
2354 if (sp->unsync_children)
2355 kvm_make_request(KVM_REQ_MMU_SYNC, vcpu);
2356
2357 __clear_sp_write_flooding_count(sp);
2358 trace_kvm_mmu_get_page(sp, false);
2359 goto out;
2360 }
2361
2362 ++vcpu->kvm->stat.mmu_cache_miss;
2363
2364 sp = kvm_mmu_alloc_page(vcpu, direct);
2365
2366 sp->gfn = gfn;
2367 sp->role = role;
2368 hlist_add_head(&sp->hash_link,
2369 &vcpu->kvm->arch.mmu_page_hash[kvm_page_table_hashfn(gfn)]);
2370 if (!direct) {
2371 /*
2372 * we should do write protection before syncing pages
2373 * otherwise the content of the synced shadow page may
2374 * be inconsistent with guest page table.
2375 */
2376 account_shadowed(vcpu->kvm, sp);
2377 if (level == PT_PAGE_TABLE_LEVEL &&
2378 rmap_write_protect(vcpu, gfn))
2379 kvm_flush_remote_tlbs(vcpu->kvm);
2380
2381 if (level > PT_PAGE_TABLE_LEVEL && need_sync)
2382 flush |= kvm_sync_pages(vcpu, gfn, &invalid_list);
2383 }
2384 sp->mmu_valid_gen = vcpu->kvm->arch.mmu_valid_gen;
2385 clear_page(sp->spt);
2386 trace_kvm_mmu_get_page(sp, true);
2387
2388 kvm_mmu_flush_or_zap(vcpu, &invalid_list, false, flush);
2389out:
2390 if (collisions > vcpu->kvm->stat.max_mmu_page_hash_collisions)
2391 vcpu->kvm->stat.max_mmu_page_hash_collisions = collisions;
2392 return sp;
2393}
2394
2395static void shadow_walk_init(struct kvm_shadow_walk_iterator *iterator,
2396 struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu, u64 addr)
2397{
2398 iterator->addr = addr;
2399 iterator->shadow_addr = vcpu->arch.mmu.root_hpa;
2400 iterator->level = vcpu->arch.mmu.shadow_root_level;
2401
2402 if (iterator->level == PT64_ROOT_4LEVEL &&
2403 vcpu->arch.mmu.root_level < PT64_ROOT_4LEVEL &&
2404 !vcpu->arch.mmu.direct_map)
2405 --iterator->level;
2406
2407 if (iterator->level == PT32E_ROOT_LEVEL) {
2408 iterator->shadow_addr
2409 = vcpu->arch.mmu.pae_root[(addr >> 30) & 3];
2410 iterator->shadow_addr &= PT64_BASE_ADDR_MASK;
2411 --iterator->level;
2412 if (!iterator->shadow_addr)
2413 iterator->level = 0;
2414 }
2415}
2416
2417static bool shadow_walk_okay(struct kvm_shadow_walk_iterator *iterator)
2418{
2419 if (iterator->level < PT_PAGE_TABLE_LEVEL)
2420 return false;
2421
2422 iterator->index = SHADOW_PT_INDEX(iterator->addr, iterator->level);
2423 iterator->sptep = ((u64 *)__va(iterator->shadow_addr)) + iterator->index;
2424 return true;
2425}
2426
2427static void __shadow_walk_next(struct kvm_shadow_walk_iterator *iterator,
2428 u64 spte)
2429{
2430 if (is_last_spte(spte, iterator->level)) {
2431 iterator->level = 0;
2432 return;
2433 }
2434
2435 iterator->shadow_addr = spte & PT64_BASE_ADDR_MASK;
2436 --iterator->level;
2437}
2438
2439static void shadow_walk_next(struct kvm_shadow_walk_iterator *iterator)
2440{
2441 return __shadow_walk_next(iterator, *iterator->sptep);
2442}
2443
2444static void link_shadow_page(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu, u64 *sptep,
2445 struct kvm_mmu_page *sp)
2446{
2447 u64 spte;
2448
2449 BUILD_BUG_ON(VMX_EPT_WRITABLE_MASK != PT_WRITABLE_MASK);
2450
2451 spte = __pa(sp->spt) | shadow_present_mask | PT_WRITABLE_MASK |
2452 shadow_user_mask | shadow_x_mask | shadow_me_mask;
2453
2454 if (sp_ad_disabled(sp))
2455 spte |= shadow_acc_track_value;
2456 else
2457 spte |= shadow_accessed_mask;
2458
2459 mmu_spte_set(sptep, spte);
2460
2461 mmu_page_add_parent_pte(vcpu, sp, sptep);
2462
2463 if (sp->unsync_children || sp->unsync)
2464 mark_unsync(sptep);
2465}
2466
2467static void validate_direct_spte(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu, u64 *sptep,
2468 unsigned direct_access)
2469{
2470 if (is_shadow_present_pte(*sptep) && !is_large_pte(*sptep)) {
2471 struct kvm_mmu_page *child;
2472
2473 /*
2474 * For the direct sp, if the guest pte's dirty bit
2475 * changed form clean to dirty, it will corrupt the
2476 * sp's access: allow writable in the read-only sp,
2477 * so we should update the spte at this point to get
2478 * a new sp with the correct access.
2479 */
2480 child = page_header(*sptep & PT64_BASE_ADDR_MASK);
2481 if (child->role.access == direct_access)
2482 return;
2483
2484 drop_parent_pte(child, sptep);
2485 kvm_flush_remote_tlbs(vcpu->kvm);
2486 }
2487}
2488
2489static bool mmu_page_zap_pte(struct kvm *kvm, struct kvm_mmu_page *sp,
2490 u64 *spte)
2491{
2492 u64 pte;
2493 struct kvm_mmu_page *child;
2494
2495 pte = *spte;
2496 if (is_shadow_present_pte(pte)) {
2497 if (is_last_spte(pte, sp->role.level)) {
2498 drop_spte(kvm, spte);
2499 if (is_large_pte(pte))
2500 --kvm->stat.lpages;
2501 } else {
2502 child = page_header(pte & PT64_BASE_ADDR_MASK);
2503 drop_parent_pte(child, spte);
2504 }
2505 return true;
2506 }
2507
2508 if (is_mmio_spte(pte))
2509 mmu_spte_clear_no_track(spte);
2510
2511 return false;
2512}
2513
2514static void kvm_mmu_page_unlink_children(struct kvm *kvm,
2515 struct kvm_mmu_page *sp)
2516{
2517 unsigned i;
2518
2519 for (i = 0; i < PT64_ENT_PER_PAGE; ++i)
2520 mmu_page_zap_pte(kvm, sp, sp->spt + i);
2521}
2522
2523static void kvm_mmu_unlink_parents(struct kvm *kvm, struct kvm_mmu_page *sp)
2524{
2525 u64 *sptep;
2526 struct rmap_iterator iter;
2527
2528 while ((sptep = rmap_get_first(&sp->parent_ptes, &iter)))
2529 drop_parent_pte(sp, sptep);
2530}
2531
2532static int mmu_zap_unsync_children(struct kvm *kvm,
2533 struct kvm_mmu_page *parent,
2534 struct list_head *invalid_list)
2535{
2536 int i, zapped = 0;
2537 struct mmu_page_path parents;
2538 struct kvm_mmu_pages pages;
2539
2540 if (parent->role.level == PT_PAGE_TABLE_LEVEL)
2541 return 0;
2542
2543 while (mmu_unsync_walk(parent, &pages)) {
2544 struct kvm_mmu_page *sp;
2545
2546 for_each_sp(pages, sp, parents, i) {
2547 kvm_mmu_prepare_zap_page(kvm, sp, invalid_list);
2548 mmu_pages_clear_parents(&parents);
2549 zapped++;
2550 }
2551 }
2552
2553 return zapped;
2554}
2555
2556static int kvm_mmu_prepare_zap_page(struct kvm *kvm, struct kvm_mmu_page *sp,
2557 struct list_head *invalid_list)
2558{
2559 int ret;
2560
2561 trace_kvm_mmu_prepare_zap_page(sp);
2562 ++kvm->stat.mmu_shadow_zapped;
2563 ret = mmu_zap_unsync_children(kvm, sp, invalid_list);
2564 kvm_mmu_page_unlink_children(kvm, sp);
2565 kvm_mmu_unlink_parents(kvm, sp);
2566
2567 if (!sp->role.invalid && !sp->role.direct)
2568 unaccount_shadowed(kvm, sp);
2569
2570 if (sp->unsync)
2571 kvm_unlink_unsync_page(kvm, sp);
2572 if (!sp->root_count) {
2573 /* Count self */
2574 ret++;
2575 list_move(&sp->link, invalid_list);
2576 kvm_mod_used_mmu_pages(kvm, -1);
2577 } else {
2578 list_move(&sp->link, &kvm->arch.active_mmu_pages);
2579
2580 /*
2581 * The obsolete pages can not be used on any vcpus.
2582 * See the comments in kvm_mmu_invalidate_zap_all_pages().
2583 */
2584 if (!sp->role.invalid && !is_obsolete_sp(kvm, sp))
2585 kvm_reload_remote_mmus(kvm);
2586 }
2587
2588 sp->role.invalid = 1;
2589 return ret;
2590}
2591
2592static void kvm_mmu_commit_zap_page(struct kvm *kvm,
2593 struct list_head *invalid_list)
2594{
2595 struct kvm_mmu_page *sp, *nsp;
2596
2597 if (list_empty(invalid_list))
2598 return;
2599
2600 /*
2601 * We need to make sure everyone sees our modifications to
2602 * the page tables and see changes to vcpu->mode here. The barrier
2603 * in the kvm_flush_remote_tlbs() achieves this. This pairs
2604 * with vcpu_enter_guest and walk_shadow_page_lockless_begin/end.
2605 *
2606 * In addition, kvm_flush_remote_tlbs waits for all vcpus to exit
2607 * guest mode and/or lockless shadow page table walks.
2608 */
2609 kvm_flush_remote_tlbs(kvm);
2610
2611 list_for_each_entry_safe(sp, nsp, invalid_list, link) {
2612 WARN_ON(!sp->role.invalid || sp->root_count);
2613 kvm_mmu_free_page(sp);
2614 }
2615}
2616
2617static bool prepare_zap_oldest_mmu_page(struct kvm *kvm,
2618 struct list_head *invalid_list)
2619{
2620 struct kvm_mmu_page *sp;
2621
2622 if (list_empty(&kvm->arch.active_mmu_pages))
2623 return false;
2624
2625 sp = list_last_entry(&kvm->arch.active_mmu_pages,
2626 struct kvm_mmu_page, link);
2627 return kvm_mmu_prepare_zap_page(kvm, sp, invalid_list);
2628}
2629
2630/*
2631 * Changing the number of mmu pages allocated to the vm
2632 * Note: if goal_nr_mmu_pages is too small, you will get dead lock
2633 */
2634void kvm_mmu_change_mmu_pages(struct kvm *kvm, unsigned int goal_nr_mmu_pages)
2635{
2636 LIST_HEAD(invalid_list);
2637
2638 spin_lock(&kvm->mmu_lock);
2639
2640 if (kvm->arch.n_used_mmu_pages > goal_nr_mmu_pages) {
2641 /* Need to free some mmu pages to achieve the goal. */
2642 while (kvm->arch.n_used_mmu_pages > goal_nr_mmu_pages)
2643 if (!prepare_zap_oldest_mmu_page(kvm, &invalid_list))
2644 break;
2645
2646 kvm_mmu_commit_zap_page(kvm, &invalid_list);
2647 goal_nr_mmu_pages = kvm->arch.n_used_mmu_pages;
2648 }
2649
2650 kvm->arch.n_max_mmu_pages = goal_nr_mmu_pages;
2651
2652 spin_unlock(&kvm->mmu_lock);
2653}
2654
2655int kvm_mmu_unprotect_page(struct kvm *kvm, gfn_t gfn)
2656{
2657 struct kvm_mmu_page *sp;
2658 LIST_HEAD(invalid_list);
2659 int r;
2660
2661 pgprintk("%s: looking for gfn %llx\n", __func__, gfn);
2662 r = 0;
2663 spin_lock(&kvm->mmu_lock);
2664 for_each_gfn_indirect_valid_sp(kvm, sp, gfn) {
2665 pgprintk("%s: gfn %llx role %x\n", __func__, gfn,
2666 sp->role.word);
2667 r = 1;
2668 kvm_mmu_prepare_zap_page(kvm, sp, &invalid_list);
2669 }
2670 kvm_mmu_commit_zap_page(kvm, &invalid_list);
2671 spin_unlock(&kvm->mmu_lock);
2672
2673 return r;
2674}
2675EXPORT_SYMBOL_GPL(kvm_mmu_unprotect_page);
2676
2677static void kvm_unsync_page(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu, struct kvm_mmu_page *sp)
2678{
2679 trace_kvm_mmu_unsync_page(sp);
2680 ++vcpu->kvm->stat.mmu_unsync;
2681 sp->unsync = 1;
2682
2683 kvm_mmu_mark_parents_unsync(sp);
2684}
2685
2686static bool mmu_need_write_protect(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu, gfn_t gfn,
2687 bool can_unsync)
2688{
2689 struct kvm_mmu_page *sp;
2690
2691 if (kvm_page_track_is_active(vcpu, gfn, KVM_PAGE_TRACK_WRITE))
2692 return true;
2693
2694 for_each_gfn_indirect_valid_sp(vcpu->kvm, sp, gfn) {
2695 if (!can_unsync)
2696 return true;
2697
2698 if (sp->unsync)
2699 continue;
2700
2701 WARN_ON(sp->role.level != PT_PAGE_TABLE_LEVEL);
2702 kvm_unsync_page(vcpu, sp);
2703 }
2704
2705 return false;
2706}
2707
2708static bool kvm_is_mmio_pfn(kvm_pfn_t pfn)
2709{
2710 if (pfn_valid(pfn))
2711 return !is_zero_pfn(pfn) && PageReserved(pfn_to_page(pfn));
2712
2713 return true;
2714}
2715
2716static int set_spte(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu, u64 *sptep,
2717 unsigned pte_access, int level,
2718 gfn_t gfn, kvm_pfn_t pfn, bool speculative,
2719 bool can_unsync, bool host_writable)
2720{
2721 u64 spte = 0;
2722 int ret = 0;
2723 struct kvm_mmu_page *sp;
2724
2725 if (set_mmio_spte(vcpu, sptep, gfn, pfn, pte_access))
2726 return 0;
2727
2728 sp = page_header(__pa(sptep));
2729 if (sp_ad_disabled(sp))
2730 spte |= shadow_acc_track_value;
2731
2732 /*
2733 * For the EPT case, shadow_present_mask is 0 if hardware
2734 * supports exec-only page table entries. In that case,
2735 * ACC_USER_MASK and shadow_user_mask are used to represent
2736 * read access. See FNAME(gpte_access) in paging_tmpl.h.
2737 */
2738 spte |= shadow_present_mask;
2739 if (!speculative)
2740 spte |= spte_shadow_accessed_mask(spte);
2741
2742 if (pte_access & ACC_EXEC_MASK)
2743 spte |= shadow_x_mask;
2744 else
2745 spte |= shadow_nx_mask;
2746
2747 if (pte_access & ACC_USER_MASK)
2748 spte |= shadow_user_mask;
2749
2750 if (level > PT_PAGE_TABLE_LEVEL)
2751 spte |= PT_PAGE_SIZE_MASK;
2752 if (tdp_enabled)
2753 spte |= kvm_x86_ops->get_mt_mask(vcpu, gfn,
2754 kvm_is_mmio_pfn(pfn));
2755
2756 if (host_writable)
2757 spte |= SPTE_HOST_WRITEABLE;
2758 else
2759 pte_access &= ~ACC_WRITE_MASK;
2760
2761 if (!kvm_is_mmio_pfn(pfn))
2762 spte |= shadow_me_mask;
2763
2764 spte |= (u64)pfn << PAGE_SHIFT;
2765
2766 if (pte_access & ACC_WRITE_MASK) {
2767
2768 /*
2769 * Other vcpu creates new sp in the window between
2770 * mapping_level() and acquiring mmu-lock. We can
2771 * allow guest to retry the access, the mapping can
2772 * be fixed if guest refault.
2773 */
2774 if (level > PT_PAGE_TABLE_LEVEL &&
2775 mmu_gfn_lpage_is_disallowed(vcpu, gfn, level))
2776 goto done;
2777
2778 spte |= PT_WRITABLE_MASK | SPTE_MMU_WRITEABLE;
2779
2780 /*
2781 * Optimization: for pte sync, if spte was writable the hash
2782 * lookup is unnecessary (and expensive). Write protection
2783 * is responsibility of mmu_get_page / kvm_sync_page.
2784 * Same reasoning can be applied to dirty page accounting.
2785 */
2786 if (!can_unsync && is_writable_pte(*sptep))
2787 goto set_pte;
2788
2789 if (mmu_need_write_protect(vcpu, gfn, can_unsync)) {
2790 pgprintk("%s: found shadow page for %llx, marking ro\n",
2791 __func__, gfn);
2792 ret = 1;
2793 pte_access &= ~ACC_WRITE_MASK;
2794 spte &= ~(PT_WRITABLE_MASK | SPTE_MMU_WRITEABLE);
2795 }
2796 }
2797
2798 if (pte_access & ACC_WRITE_MASK) {
2799 kvm_vcpu_mark_page_dirty(vcpu, gfn);
2800 spte |= spte_shadow_dirty_mask(spte);
2801 }
2802
2803 if (speculative)
2804 spte = mark_spte_for_access_track(spte);
2805
2806set_pte:
2807 if (mmu_spte_update(sptep, spte))
2808 kvm_flush_remote_tlbs(vcpu->kvm);
2809done:
2810 return ret;
2811}
2812
2813static int mmu_set_spte(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu, u64 *sptep, unsigned pte_access,
2814 int write_fault, int level, gfn_t gfn, kvm_pfn_t pfn,
2815 bool speculative, bool host_writable)
2816{
2817 int was_rmapped = 0;
2818 int rmap_count;
2819 int ret = RET_PF_RETRY;
2820
2821 pgprintk("%s: spte %llx write_fault %d gfn %llx\n", __func__,
2822 *sptep, write_fault, gfn);
2823
2824 if (is_shadow_present_pte(*sptep)) {
2825 /*
2826 * If we overwrite a PTE page pointer with a 2MB PMD, unlink
2827 * the parent of the now unreachable PTE.
2828 */
2829 if (level > PT_PAGE_TABLE_LEVEL &&
2830 !is_large_pte(*sptep)) {
2831 struct kvm_mmu_page *child;
2832 u64 pte = *sptep;
2833
2834 child = page_header(pte & PT64_BASE_ADDR_MASK);
2835 drop_parent_pte(child, sptep);
2836 kvm_flush_remote_tlbs(vcpu->kvm);
2837 } else if (pfn != spte_to_pfn(*sptep)) {
2838 pgprintk("hfn old %llx new %llx\n",
2839 spte_to_pfn(*sptep), pfn);
2840 drop_spte(vcpu->kvm, sptep);
2841 kvm_flush_remote_tlbs(vcpu->kvm);
2842 } else
2843 was_rmapped = 1;
2844 }
2845
2846 if (set_spte(vcpu, sptep, pte_access, level, gfn, pfn, speculative,
2847 true, host_writable)) {
2848 if (write_fault)
2849 ret = RET_PF_EMULATE;
2850 kvm_make_request(KVM_REQ_TLB_FLUSH, vcpu);
2851 }
2852
2853 if (unlikely(is_mmio_spte(*sptep)))
2854 ret = RET_PF_EMULATE;
2855
2856 pgprintk("%s: setting spte %llx\n", __func__, *sptep);
2857 pgprintk("instantiating %s PTE (%s) at %llx (%llx) addr %p\n",
2858 is_large_pte(*sptep)? "2MB" : "4kB",
2859 *sptep & PT_WRITABLE_MASK ? "RW" : "R", gfn,
2860 *sptep, sptep);
2861 if (!was_rmapped && is_large_pte(*sptep))
2862 ++vcpu->kvm->stat.lpages;
2863
2864 if (is_shadow_present_pte(*sptep)) {
2865 if (!was_rmapped) {
2866 rmap_count = rmap_add(vcpu, sptep, gfn);
2867 if (rmap_count > RMAP_RECYCLE_THRESHOLD)
2868 rmap_recycle(vcpu, sptep, gfn);
2869 }
2870 }
2871
2872 kvm_release_pfn_clean(pfn);
2873
2874 return ret;
2875}
2876
2877static kvm_pfn_t pte_prefetch_gfn_to_pfn(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu, gfn_t gfn,
2878 bool no_dirty_log)
2879{
2880 struct kvm_memory_slot *slot;
2881
2882 slot = gfn_to_memslot_dirty_bitmap(vcpu, gfn, no_dirty_log);
2883 if (!slot)
2884 return KVM_PFN_ERR_FAULT;
2885
2886 return gfn_to_pfn_memslot_atomic(slot, gfn);
2887}
2888
2889static int direct_pte_prefetch_many(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu,
2890 struct kvm_mmu_page *sp,
2891 u64 *start, u64 *end)
2892{
2893 struct page *pages[PTE_PREFETCH_NUM];
2894 struct kvm_memory_slot *slot;
2895 unsigned access = sp->role.access;
2896 int i, ret;
2897 gfn_t gfn;
2898
2899 gfn = kvm_mmu_page_get_gfn(sp, start - sp->spt);
2900 slot = gfn_to_memslot_dirty_bitmap(vcpu, gfn, access & ACC_WRITE_MASK);
2901 if (!slot)
2902 return -1;
2903
2904 ret = gfn_to_page_many_atomic(slot, gfn, pages, end - start);
2905 if (ret <= 0)
2906 return -1;
2907
2908 for (i = 0; i < ret; i++, gfn++, start++)
2909 mmu_set_spte(vcpu, start, access, 0, sp->role.level, gfn,
2910 page_to_pfn(pages[i]), true, true);
2911
2912 return 0;
2913}
2914
2915static void __direct_pte_prefetch(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu,
2916 struct kvm_mmu_page *sp, u64 *sptep)
2917{
2918 u64 *spte, *start = NULL;
2919 int i;
2920
2921 WARN_ON(!sp->role.direct);
2922
2923 i = (sptep - sp->spt) & ~(PTE_PREFETCH_NUM - 1);
2924 spte = sp->spt + i;
2925
2926 for (i = 0; i < PTE_PREFETCH_NUM; i++, spte++) {
2927 if (is_shadow_present_pte(*spte) || spte == sptep) {
2928 if (!start)
2929 continue;
2930 if (direct_pte_prefetch_many(vcpu, sp, start, spte) < 0)
2931 break;
2932 start = NULL;
2933 } else if (!start)
2934 start = spte;
2935 }
2936}
2937
2938static void direct_pte_prefetch(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu, u64 *sptep)
2939{
2940 struct kvm_mmu_page *sp;
2941
2942 sp = page_header(__pa(sptep));
2943
2944 /*
2945 * Without accessed bits, there's no way to distinguish between
2946 * actually accessed translations and prefetched, so disable pte
2947 * prefetch if accessed bits aren't available.
2948 */
2949 if (sp_ad_disabled(sp))
2950 return;
2951
2952 if (sp->role.level > PT_PAGE_TABLE_LEVEL)
2953 return;
2954
2955 __direct_pte_prefetch(vcpu, sp, sptep);
2956}
2957
2958static int __direct_map(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu, int write, int map_writable,
2959 int level, gfn_t gfn, kvm_pfn_t pfn, bool prefault)
2960{
2961 struct kvm_shadow_walk_iterator iterator;
2962 struct kvm_mmu_page *sp;
2963 int emulate = 0;
2964 gfn_t pseudo_gfn;
2965
2966 if (!VALID_PAGE(vcpu->arch.mmu.root_hpa))
2967 return 0;
2968
2969 for_each_shadow_entry(vcpu, (u64)gfn << PAGE_SHIFT, iterator) {
2970 if (iterator.level == level) {
2971 emulate = mmu_set_spte(vcpu, iterator.sptep, ACC_ALL,
2972 write, level, gfn, pfn, prefault,
2973 map_writable);
2974 direct_pte_prefetch(vcpu, iterator.sptep);
2975 ++vcpu->stat.pf_fixed;
2976 break;
2977 }
2978
2979 drop_large_spte(vcpu, iterator.sptep);
2980 if (!is_shadow_present_pte(*iterator.sptep)) {
2981 u64 base_addr = iterator.addr;
2982
2983 base_addr &= PT64_LVL_ADDR_MASK(iterator.level);
2984 pseudo_gfn = base_addr >> PAGE_SHIFT;
2985 sp = kvm_mmu_get_page(vcpu, pseudo_gfn, iterator.addr,
2986 iterator.level - 1, 1, ACC_ALL);
2987
2988 link_shadow_page(vcpu, iterator.sptep, sp);
2989 }
2990 }
2991 return emulate;
2992}
2993
2994static void kvm_send_hwpoison_signal(unsigned long address, struct task_struct *tsk)
2995{
2996 siginfo_t info;
2997
2998 info.si_signo = SIGBUS;
2999 info.si_errno = 0;
3000 info.si_code = BUS_MCEERR_AR;
3001 info.si_addr = (void __user *)address;
3002 info.si_addr_lsb = PAGE_SHIFT;
3003
3004 send_sig_info(SIGBUS, &info, tsk);
3005}
3006
3007static int kvm_handle_bad_page(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu, gfn_t gfn, kvm_pfn_t pfn)
3008{
3009 /*
3010 * Do not cache the mmio info caused by writing the readonly gfn
3011 * into the spte otherwise read access on readonly gfn also can
3012 * caused mmio page fault and treat it as mmio access.
3013 */
3014 if (pfn == KVM_PFN_ERR_RO_FAULT)
3015 return RET_PF_EMULATE;
3016
3017 if (pfn == KVM_PFN_ERR_HWPOISON) {
3018 kvm_send_hwpoison_signal(kvm_vcpu_gfn_to_hva(vcpu, gfn), current);
3019 return RET_PF_RETRY;
3020 }
3021
3022 return -EFAULT;
3023}
3024
3025static void transparent_hugepage_adjust(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu,
3026 gfn_t *gfnp, kvm_pfn_t *pfnp,
3027 int *levelp)
3028{
3029 kvm_pfn_t pfn = *pfnp;
3030 gfn_t gfn = *gfnp;
3031 int level = *levelp;
3032
3033 /*
3034 * Check if it's a transparent hugepage. If this would be an
3035 * hugetlbfs page, level wouldn't be set to
3036 * PT_PAGE_TABLE_LEVEL and there would be no adjustment done
3037 * here.
3038 */
3039 if (!is_error_noslot_pfn(pfn) && !kvm_is_reserved_pfn(pfn) &&
3040 level == PT_PAGE_TABLE_LEVEL &&
3041 PageTransCompoundMap(pfn_to_page(pfn)) &&
3042 !mmu_gfn_lpage_is_disallowed(vcpu, gfn, PT_DIRECTORY_LEVEL)) {
3043 unsigned long mask;
3044 /*
3045 * mmu_notifier_retry was successful and we hold the
3046 * mmu_lock here, so the pmd can't become splitting
3047 * from under us, and in turn
3048 * __split_huge_page_refcount() can't run from under
3049 * us and we can safely transfer the refcount from
3050 * PG_tail to PG_head as we switch the pfn to tail to
3051 * head.
3052 */
3053 *levelp = level = PT_DIRECTORY_LEVEL;
3054 mask = KVM_PAGES_PER_HPAGE(level) - 1;
3055 VM_BUG_ON((gfn & mask) != (pfn & mask));
3056 if (pfn & mask) {
3057 gfn &= ~mask;
3058 *gfnp = gfn;
3059 kvm_release_pfn_clean(pfn);
3060 pfn &= ~mask;
3061 kvm_get_pfn(pfn);
3062 *pfnp = pfn;
3063 }
3064 }
3065}
3066
3067static bool handle_abnormal_pfn(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu, gva_t gva, gfn_t gfn,
3068 kvm_pfn_t pfn, unsigned access, int *ret_val)
3069{
3070 /* The pfn is invalid, report the error! */
3071 if (unlikely(is_error_pfn(pfn))) {
3072 *ret_val = kvm_handle_bad_page(vcpu, gfn, pfn);
3073 return true;
3074 }
3075
3076 if (unlikely(is_noslot_pfn(pfn)))
3077 vcpu_cache_mmio_info(vcpu, gva, gfn, access);
3078
3079 return false;
3080}
3081
3082static bool page_fault_can_be_fast(u32 error_code)
3083{
3084 /*
3085 * Do not fix the mmio spte with invalid generation number which
3086 * need to be updated by slow page fault path.
3087 */
3088 if (unlikely(error_code & PFERR_RSVD_MASK))
3089 return false;
3090
3091 /* See if the page fault is due to an NX violation */
3092 if (unlikely(((error_code & (PFERR_FETCH_MASK | PFERR_PRESENT_MASK))
3093 == (PFERR_FETCH_MASK | PFERR_PRESENT_MASK))))
3094 return false;
3095
3096 /*
3097 * #PF can be fast if:
3098 * 1. The shadow page table entry is not present, which could mean that
3099 * the fault is potentially caused by access tracking (if enabled).
3100 * 2. The shadow page table entry is present and the fault
3101 * is caused by write-protect, that means we just need change the W
3102 * bit of the spte which can be done out of mmu-lock.
3103 *
3104 * However, if access tracking is disabled we know that a non-present
3105 * page must be a genuine page fault where we have to create a new SPTE.
3106 * So, if access tracking is disabled, we return true only for write
3107 * accesses to a present page.
3108 */
3109
3110 return shadow_acc_track_mask != 0 ||
3111 ((error_code & (PFERR_WRITE_MASK | PFERR_PRESENT_MASK))
3112 == (PFERR_WRITE_MASK | PFERR_PRESENT_MASK));
3113}
3114
3115/*
3116 * Returns true if the SPTE was fixed successfully. Otherwise,
3117 * someone else modified the SPTE from its original value.
3118 */
3119static bool
3120fast_pf_fix_direct_spte(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu, struct kvm_mmu_page *sp,
3121 u64 *sptep, u64 old_spte, u64 new_spte)
3122{
3123 gfn_t gfn;
3124
3125 WARN_ON(!sp->role.direct);
3126
3127 /*
3128 * Theoretically we could also set dirty bit (and flush TLB) here in
3129 * order to eliminate unnecessary PML logging. See comments in
3130 * set_spte. But fast_page_fault is very unlikely to happen with PML
3131 * enabled, so we do not do this. This might result in the same GPA
3132 * to be logged in PML buffer again when the write really happens, and
3133 * eventually to be called by mark_page_dirty twice. But it's also no
3134 * harm. This also avoids the TLB flush needed after setting dirty bit
3135 * so non-PML cases won't be impacted.
3136 *
3137 * Compare with set_spte where instead shadow_dirty_mask is set.
3138 */
3139 if (cmpxchg64(sptep, old_spte, new_spte) != old_spte)
3140 return false;
3141
3142 if (is_writable_pte(new_spte) && !is_writable_pte(old_spte)) {
3143 /*
3144 * The gfn of direct spte is stable since it is
3145 * calculated by sp->gfn.
3146 */
3147 gfn = kvm_mmu_page_get_gfn(sp, sptep - sp->spt);
3148 kvm_vcpu_mark_page_dirty(vcpu, gfn);
3149 }
3150
3151 return true;
3152}
3153
3154static bool is_access_allowed(u32 fault_err_code, u64 spte)
3155{
3156 if (fault_err_code & PFERR_FETCH_MASK)
3157 return is_executable_pte(spte);
3158
3159 if (fault_err_code & PFERR_WRITE_MASK)
3160 return is_writable_pte(spte);
3161
3162 /* Fault was on Read access */
3163 return spte & PT_PRESENT_MASK;
3164}
3165
3166/*
3167 * Return value:
3168 * - true: let the vcpu to access on the same address again.
3169 * - false: let the real page fault path to fix it.
3170 */
3171static bool fast_page_fault(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu, gva_t gva, int level,
3172 u32 error_code)
3173{
3174 struct kvm_shadow_walk_iterator iterator;
3175 struct kvm_mmu_page *sp;
3176 bool fault_handled = false;
3177 u64 spte = 0ull;
3178 uint retry_count = 0;
3179
3180 if (!VALID_PAGE(vcpu->arch.mmu.root_hpa))
3181 return false;
3182
3183 if (!page_fault_can_be_fast(error_code))
3184 return false;
3185
3186 walk_shadow_page_lockless_begin(vcpu);
3187
3188 do {
3189 u64 new_spte;
3190
3191 for_each_shadow_entry_lockless(vcpu, gva, iterator, spte)
3192 if (!is_shadow_present_pte(spte) ||
3193 iterator.level < level)
3194 break;
3195
3196 sp = page_header(__pa(iterator.sptep));
3197 if (!is_last_spte(spte, sp->role.level))
3198 break;
3199
3200 /*
3201 * Check whether the memory access that caused the fault would
3202 * still cause it if it were to be performed right now. If not,
3203 * then this is a spurious fault caused by TLB lazily flushed,
3204 * or some other CPU has already fixed the PTE after the
3205 * current CPU took the fault.
3206 *
3207 * Need not check the access of upper level table entries since
3208 * they are always ACC_ALL.
3209 */
3210 if (is_access_allowed(error_code, spte)) {
3211 fault_handled = true;
3212 break;
3213 }
3214
3215 new_spte = spte;
3216
3217 if (is_access_track_spte(spte))
3218 new_spte = restore_acc_track_spte(new_spte);
3219
3220 /*
3221 * Currently, to simplify the code, write-protection can
3222 * be removed in the fast path only if the SPTE was
3223 * write-protected for dirty-logging or access tracking.
3224 */
3225 if ((error_code & PFERR_WRITE_MASK) &&
3226 spte_can_locklessly_be_made_writable(spte))
3227 {
3228 new_spte |= PT_WRITABLE_MASK;
3229
3230 /*
3231 * Do not fix write-permission on the large spte. Since
3232 * we only dirty the first page into the dirty-bitmap in
3233 * fast_pf_fix_direct_spte(), other pages are missed
3234 * if its slot has dirty logging enabled.
3235 *
3236 * Instead, we let the slow page fault path create a
3237 * normal spte to fix the access.
3238 *
3239 * See the comments in kvm_arch_commit_memory_region().
3240 */
3241 if (sp->role.level > PT_PAGE_TABLE_LEVEL)
3242 break;
3243 }
3244
3245 /* Verify that the fault can be handled in the fast path */
3246 if (new_spte == spte ||
3247 !is_access_allowed(error_code, new_spte))
3248 break;
3249
3250 /*
3251 * Currently, fast page fault only works for direct mapping
3252 * since the gfn is not stable for indirect shadow page. See
3253 * Documentation/virtual/kvm/locking.txt to get more detail.
3254 */
3255 fault_handled = fast_pf_fix_direct_spte(vcpu, sp,
3256 iterator.sptep, spte,
3257 new_spte);
3258 if (fault_handled)
3259 break;
3260
3261 if (++retry_count > 4) {
3262 printk_once(KERN_WARNING
3263 "kvm: Fast #PF retrying more than 4 times.\n");
3264 break;
3265 }
3266
3267 } while (true);
3268
3269 trace_fast_page_fault(vcpu, gva, error_code, iterator.sptep,
3270 spte, fault_handled);
3271 walk_shadow_page_lockless_end(vcpu);
3272
3273 return fault_handled;
3274}
3275
3276static bool try_async_pf(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu, bool prefault, gfn_t gfn,
3277 gva_t gva, kvm_pfn_t *pfn, bool write, bool *writable);
3278static int make_mmu_pages_available(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu);
3279
3280static int nonpaging_map(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu, gva_t v, u32 error_code,
3281 gfn_t gfn, bool prefault)
3282{
3283 int r;
3284 int level;
3285 bool force_pt_level = false;
3286 kvm_pfn_t pfn;
3287 unsigned long mmu_seq;
3288 bool map_writable, write = error_code & PFERR_WRITE_MASK;
3289
3290 level = mapping_level(vcpu, gfn, &force_pt_level);
3291 if (likely(!force_pt_level)) {
3292 /*
3293 * This path builds a PAE pagetable - so we can map
3294 * 2mb pages at maximum. Therefore check if the level
3295 * is larger than that.
3296 */
3297 if (level > PT_DIRECTORY_LEVEL)
3298 level = PT_DIRECTORY_LEVEL;
3299
3300 gfn &= ~(KVM_PAGES_PER_HPAGE(level) - 1);
3301 }
3302
3303 if (fast_page_fault(vcpu, v, level, error_code))
3304 return RET_PF_RETRY;
3305
3306 mmu_seq = vcpu->kvm->mmu_notifier_seq;
3307 smp_rmb();
3308
3309 if (try_async_pf(vcpu, prefault, gfn, v, &pfn, write, &map_writable))
3310 return RET_PF_RETRY;
3311
3312 if (handle_abnormal_pfn(vcpu, v, gfn, pfn, ACC_ALL, &r))
3313 return r;
3314
3315 spin_lock(&vcpu->kvm->mmu_lock);
3316 if (mmu_notifier_retry(vcpu->kvm, mmu_seq))
3317 goto out_unlock;
3318 if (make_mmu_pages_available(vcpu) < 0)
3319 goto out_unlock;
3320 if (likely(!force_pt_level))
3321 transparent_hugepage_adjust(vcpu, &gfn, &pfn, &level);
3322 r = __direct_map(vcpu, write, map_writable, level, gfn, pfn, prefault);
3323 spin_unlock(&vcpu->kvm->mmu_lock);
3324
3325 return r;
3326
3327out_unlock:
3328 spin_unlock(&vcpu->kvm->mmu_lock);
3329 kvm_release_pfn_clean(pfn);
3330 return RET_PF_RETRY;
3331}
3332
3333
3334static void mmu_free_roots(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu)
3335{
3336 int i;
3337 struct kvm_mmu_page *sp;
3338 LIST_HEAD(invalid_list);
3339
3340 if (!VALID_PAGE(vcpu->arch.mmu.root_hpa))
3341 return;
3342
3343 if (vcpu->arch.mmu.shadow_root_level >= PT64_ROOT_4LEVEL &&
3344 (vcpu->arch.mmu.root_level >= PT64_ROOT_4LEVEL ||
3345 vcpu->arch.mmu.direct_map)) {
3346 hpa_t root = vcpu->arch.mmu.root_hpa;
3347
3348 spin_lock(&vcpu->kvm->mmu_lock);
3349 sp = page_header(root);
3350 --sp->root_count;
3351 if (!sp->root_count && sp->role.invalid) {
3352 kvm_mmu_prepare_zap_page(vcpu->kvm, sp, &invalid_list);
3353 kvm_mmu_commit_zap_page(vcpu->kvm, &invalid_list);
3354 }
3355 spin_unlock(&vcpu->kvm->mmu_lock);
3356 vcpu->arch.mmu.root_hpa = INVALID_PAGE;
3357 return;
3358 }
3359
3360 spin_lock(&vcpu->kvm->mmu_lock);
3361 for (i = 0; i < 4; ++i) {
3362 hpa_t root = vcpu->arch.mmu.pae_root[i];
3363
3364 if (root) {
3365 root &= PT64_BASE_ADDR_MASK;
3366 sp = page_header(root);
3367 --sp->root_count;
3368 if (!sp->root_count && sp->role.invalid)
3369 kvm_mmu_prepare_zap_page(vcpu->kvm, sp,
3370 &invalid_list);
3371 }
3372 vcpu->arch.mmu.pae_root[i] = INVALID_PAGE;
3373 }
3374 kvm_mmu_commit_zap_page(vcpu->kvm, &invalid_list);
3375 spin_unlock(&vcpu->kvm->mmu_lock);
3376 vcpu->arch.mmu.root_hpa = INVALID_PAGE;
3377}
3378
3379static int mmu_check_root(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu, gfn_t root_gfn)
3380{
3381 int ret = 0;
3382
3383 if (!kvm_is_visible_gfn(vcpu->kvm, root_gfn)) {
3384 kvm_make_request(KVM_REQ_TRIPLE_FAULT, vcpu);
3385 ret = 1;
3386 }
3387
3388 return ret;
3389}
3390
3391static int mmu_alloc_direct_roots(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu)
3392{
3393 struct kvm_mmu_page *sp;
3394 unsigned i;
3395
3396 if (vcpu->arch.mmu.shadow_root_level >= PT64_ROOT_4LEVEL) {
3397 spin_lock(&vcpu->kvm->mmu_lock);
3398 if(make_mmu_pages_available(vcpu) < 0) {
3399 spin_unlock(&vcpu->kvm->mmu_lock);
3400 return -ENOSPC;
3401 }
3402 sp = kvm_mmu_get_page(vcpu, 0, 0,
3403 vcpu->arch.mmu.shadow_root_level, 1, ACC_ALL);
3404 ++sp->root_count;
3405 spin_unlock(&vcpu->kvm->mmu_lock);
3406 vcpu->arch.mmu.root_hpa = __pa(sp->spt);
3407 } else if (vcpu->arch.mmu.shadow_root_level == PT32E_ROOT_LEVEL) {
3408 for (i = 0; i < 4; ++i) {
3409 hpa_t root = vcpu->arch.mmu.pae_root[i];
3410
3411 MMU_WARN_ON(VALID_PAGE(root));
3412 spin_lock(&vcpu->kvm->mmu_lock);
3413 if (make_mmu_pages_available(vcpu) < 0) {
3414 spin_unlock(&vcpu->kvm->mmu_lock);
3415 return -ENOSPC;
3416 }
3417 sp = kvm_mmu_get_page(vcpu, i << (30 - PAGE_SHIFT),
3418 i << 30, PT32_ROOT_LEVEL, 1, ACC_ALL);
3419 root = __pa(sp->spt);
3420 ++sp->root_count;
3421 spin_unlock(&vcpu->kvm->mmu_lock);
3422 vcpu->arch.mmu.pae_root[i] = root | PT_PRESENT_MASK;
3423 }
3424 vcpu->arch.mmu.root_hpa = __pa(vcpu->arch.mmu.pae_root);
3425 } else
3426 BUG();
3427
3428 return 0;
3429}
3430
3431static int mmu_alloc_shadow_roots(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu)
3432{
3433 struct kvm_mmu_page *sp;
3434 u64 pdptr, pm_mask;
3435 gfn_t root_gfn;
3436 int i;
3437
3438 root_gfn = vcpu->arch.mmu.get_cr3(vcpu) >> PAGE_SHIFT;
3439
3440 if (mmu_check_root(vcpu, root_gfn))
3441 return 1;
3442
3443 /*
3444 * Do we shadow a long mode page table? If so we need to
3445 * write-protect the guests page table root.
3446 */
3447 if (vcpu->arch.mmu.root_level >= PT64_ROOT_4LEVEL) {
3448 hpa_t root = vcpu->arch.mmu.root_hpa;
3449
3450 MMU_WARN_ON(VALID_PAGE(root));
3451
3452 spin_lock(&vcpu->kvm->mmu_lock);
3453 if (make_mmu_pages_available(vcpu) < 0) {
3454 spin_unlock(&vcpu->kvm->mmu_lock);
3455 return -ENOSPC;
3456 }
3457 sp = kvm_mmu_get_page(vcpu, root_gfn, 0,
3458 vcpu->arch.mmu.shadow_root_level, 0, ACC_ALL);
3459 root = __pa(sp->spt);
3460 ++sp->root_count;
3461 spin_unlock(&vcpu->kvm->mmu_lock);
3462 vcpu->arch.mmu.root_hpa = root;
3463 return 0;
3464 }
3465
3466 /*
3467 * We shadow a 32 bit page table. This may be a legacy 2-level
3468 * or a PAE 3-level page table. In either case we need to be aware that
3469 * the shadow page table may be a PAE or a long mode page table.
3470 */
3471 pm_mask = PT_PRESENT_MASK;
3472 if (vcpu->arch.mmu.shadow_root_level == PT64_ROOT_4LEVEL)
3473 pm_mask |= PT_ACCESSED_MASK | PT_WRITABLE_MASK | PT_USER_MASK;
3474
3475 for (i = 0; i < 4; ++i) {
3476 hpa_t root = vcpu->arch.mmu.pae_root[i];
3477
3478 MMU_WARN_ON(VALID_PAGE(root));
3479 if (vcpu->arch.mmu.root_level == PT32E_ROOT_LEVEL) {
3480 pdptr = vcpu->arch.mmu.get_pdptr(vcpu, i);
3481 if (!(pdptr & PT_PRESENT_MASK)) {
3482 vcpu->arch.mmu.pae_root[i] = 0;
3483 continue;
3484 }
3485 root_gfn = pdptr >> PAGE_SHIFT;
3486 if (mmu_check_root(vcpu, root_gfn))
3487 return 1;
3488 }
3489 spin_lock(&vcpu->kvm->mmu_lock);
3490 if (make_mmu_pages_available(vcpu) < 0) {
3491 spin_unlock(&vcpu->kvm->mmu_lock);
3492 return -ENOSPC;
3493 }
3494 sp = kvm_mmu_get_page(vcpu, root_gfn, i << 30, PT32_ROOT_LEVEL,
3495 0, ACC_ALL);
3496 root = __pa(sp->spt);
3497 ++sp->root_count;
3498 spin_unlock(&vcpu->kvm->mmu_lock);
3499
3500 vcpu->arch.mmu.pae_root[i] = root | pm_mask;
3501 }
3502 vcpu->arch.mmu.root_hpa = __pa(vcpu->arch.mmu.pae_root);
3503
3504 /*
3505 * If we shadow a 32 bit page table with a long mode page
3506 * table we enter this path.
3507 */
3508 if (vcpu->arch.mmu.shadow_root_level == PT64_ROOT_4LEVEL) {
3509 if (vcpu->arch.mmu.lm_root == NULL) {
3510 /*
3511 * The additional page necessary for this is only
3512 * allocated on demand.
3513 */
3514
3515 u64 *lm_root;
3516
3517 lm_root = (void*)get_zeroed_page(GFP_KERNEL);
3518 if (lm_root == NULL)
3519 return 1;
3520
3521 lm_root[0] = __pa(vcpu->arch.mmu.pae_root) | pm_mask;
3522
3523 vcpu->arch.mmu.lm_root = lm_root;
3524 }
3525
3526 vcpu->arch.mmu.root_hpa = __pa(vcpu->arch.mmu.lm_root);
3527 }
3528
3529 return 0;
3530}
3531
3532static int mmu_alloc_roots(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu)
3533{
3534 if (vcpu->arch.mmu.direct_map)
3535 return mmu_alloc_direct_roots(vcpu);
3536 else
3537 return mmu_alloc_shadow_roots(vcpu);
3538}
3539
3540static void mmu_sync_roots(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu)
3541{
3542 int i;
3543 struct kvm_mmu_page *sp;
3544
3545 if (vcpu->arch.mmu.direct_map)
3546 return;
3547
3548 if (!VALID_PAGE(vcpu->arch.mmu.root_hpa))
3549 return;
3550
3551 vcpu_clear_mmio_info(vcpu, MMIO_GVA_ANY);
3552 kvm_mmu_audit(vcpu, AUDIT_PRE_SYNC);
3553 if (vcpu->arch.mmu.root_level >= PT64_ROOT_4LEVEL) {
3554 hpa_t root = vcpu->arch.mmu.root_hpa;
3555 sp = page_header(root);
3556 mmu_sync_children(vcpu, sp);
3557 kvm_mmu_audit(vcpu, AUDIT_POST_SYNC);
3558 return;
3559 }
3560 for (i = 0; i < 4; ++i) {
3561 hpa_t root = vcpu->arch.mmu.pae_root[i];
3562
3563 if (root && VALID_PAGE(root)) {
3564 root &= PT64_BASE_ADDR_MASK;
3565 sp = page_header(root);
3566 mmu_sync_children(vcpu, sp);
3567 }
3568 }
3569 kvm_mmu_audit(vcpu, AUDIT_POST_SYNC);
3570}
3571
3572void kvm_mmu_sync_roots(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu)
3573{
3574 spin_lock(&vcpu->kvm->mmu_lock);
3575 mmu_sync_roots(vcpu);
3576 spin_unlock(&vcpu->kvm->mmu_lock);
3577}
3578EXPORT_SYMBOL_GPL(kvm_mmu_sync_roots);
3579
3580static gpa_t nonpaging_gva_to_gpa(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu, gva_t vaddr,
3581 u32 access, struct x86_exception *exception)
3582{
3583 if (exception)
3584 exception->error_code = 0;
3585 return vaddr;
3586}
3587
3588static gpa_t nonpaging_gva_to_gpa_nested(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu, gva_t vaddr,
3589 u32 access,
3590 struct x86_exception *exception)
3591{
3592 if (exception)
3593 exception->error_code = 0;
3594 return vcpu->arch.nested_mmu.translate_gpa(vcpu, vaddr, access, exception);
3595}
3596
3597static bool
3598__is_rsvd_bits_set(struct rsvd_bits_validate *rsvd_check, u64 pte, int level)
3599{
3600 int bit7 = (pte >> 7) & 1, low6 = pte & 0x3f;
3601
3602 return (pte & rsvd_check->rsvd_bits_mask[bit7][level-1]) |
3603 ((rsvd_check->bad_mt_xwr & (1ull << low6)) != 0);
3604}
3605
3606static bool is_rsvd_bits_set(struct kvm_mmu *mmu, u64 gpte, int level)
3607{
3608 return __is_rsvd_bits_set(&mmu->guest_rsvd_check, gpte, level);
3609}
3610
3611static bool is_shadow_zero_bits_set(struct kvm_mmu *mmu, u64 spte, int level)
3612{
3613 return __is_rsvd_bits_set(&mmu->shadow_zero_check, spte, level);
3614}
3615
3616static bool mmio_info_in_cache(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu, u64 addr, bool direct)
3617{
3618 /*
3619 * A nested guest cannot use the MMIO cache if it is using nested
3620 * page tables, because cr2 is a nGPA while the cache stores GPAs.
3621 */
3622 if (mmu_is_nested(vcpu))
3623 return false;
3624
3625 if (direct)
3626 return vcpu_match_mmio_gpa(vcpu, addr);
3627
3628 return vcpu_match_mmio_gva(vcpu, addr);
3629}
3630
3631/* return true if reserved bit is detected on spte. */
3632static bool
3633walk_shadow_page_get_mmio_spte(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu, u64 addr, u64 *sptep)
3634{
3635 struct kvm_shadow_walk_iterator iterator;
3636 u64 sptes[PT64_ROOT_MAX_LEVEL], spte = 0ull;
3637 int root, leaf;
3638 bool reserved = false;
3639
3640 if (!VALID_PAGE(vcpu->arch.mmu.root_hpa))
3641 goto exit;
3642
3643 walk_shadow_page_lockless_begin(vcpu);
3644
3645 for (shadow_walk_init(&iterator, vcpu, addr),
3646 leaf = root = iterator.level;
3647 shadow_walk_okay(&iterator);
3648 __shadow_walk_next(&iterator, spte)) {
3649 spte = mmu_spte_get_lockless(iterator.sptep);
3650
3651 sptes[leaf - 1] = spte;
3652 leaf--;
3653
3654 if (!is_shadow_present_pte(spte))
3655 break;
3656
3657 reserved |= is_shadow_zero_bits_set(&vcpu->arch.mmu, spte,
3658 iterator.level);
3659 }
3660
3661 walk_shadow_page_lockless_end(vcpu);
3662
3663 if (reserved) {
3664 pr_err("%s: detect reserved bits on spte, addr 0x%llx, dump hierarchy:\n",
3665 __func__, addr);
3666 while (root > leaf) {
3667 pr_err("------ spte 0x%llx level %d.\n",
3668 sptes[root - 1], root);
3669 root--;
3670 }
3671 }
3672exit:
3673 *sptep = spte;
3674 return reserved;
3675}
3676
3677static int handle_mmio_page_fault(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu, u64 addr, bool direct)
3678{
3679 u64 spte;
3680 bool reserved;
3681
3682 if (mmio_info_in_cache(vcpu, addr, direct))
3683 return RET_PF_EMULATE;
3684
3685 reserved = walk_shadow_page_get_mmio_spte(vcpu, addr, &spte);
3686 if (WARN_ON(reserved))
3687 return -EINVAL;
3688
3689 if (is_mmio_spte(spte)) {
3690 gfn_t gfn = get_mmio_spte_gfn(spte);
3691 unsigned access = get_mmio_spte_access(spte);
3692
3693 if (!check_mmio_spte(vcpu, spte))
3694 return RET_PF_INVALID;
3695
3696 if (direct)
3697 addr = 0;
3698
3699 trace_handle_mmio_page_fault(addr, gfn, access);
3700 vcpu_cache_mmio_info(vcpu, addr, gfn, access);
3701 return RET_PF_EMULATE;
3702 }
3703
3704 /*
3705 * If the page table is zapped by other cpus, let CPU fault again on
3706 * the address.
3707 */
3708 return RET_PF_RETRY;
3709}
3710EXPORT_SYMBOL_GPL(handle_mmio_page_fault);
3711
3712static bool page_fault_handle_page_track(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu,
3713 u32 error_code, gfn_t gfn)
3714{
3715 if (unlikely(error_code & PFERR_RSVD_MASK))
3716 return false;
3717
3718 if (!(error_code & PFERR_PRESENT_MASK) ||
3719 !(error_code & PFERR_WRITE_MASK))
3720 return false;
3721
3722 /*
3723 * guest is writing the page which is write tracked which can
3724 * not be fixed by page fault handler.
3725 */
3726 if (kvm_page_track_is_active(vcpu, gfn, KVM_PAGE_TRACK_WRITE))
3727 return true;
3728
3729 return false;
3730}
3731
3732static void shadow_page_table_clear_flood(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu, gva_t addr)
3733{
3734 struct kvm_shadow_walk_iterator iterator;
3735 u64 spte;
3736
3737 if (!VALID_PAGE(vcpu->arch.mmu.root_hpa))
3738 return;
3739
3740 walk_shadow_page_lockless_begin(vcpu);
3741 for_each_shadow_entry_lockless(vcpu, addr, iterator, spte) {
3742 clear_sp_write_flooding_count(iterator.sptep);
3743 if (!is_shadow_present_pte(spte))
3744 break;
3745 }
3746 walk_shadow_page_lockless_end(vcpu);
3747}
3748
3749static int nonpaging_page_fault(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu, gva_t gva,
3750 u32 error_code, bool prefault)
3751{
3752 gfn_t gfn = gva >> PAGE_SHIFT;
3753 int r;
3754
3755 pgprintk("%s: gva %lx error %x\n", __func__, gva, error_code);
3756
3757 if (page_fault_handle_page_track(vcpu, error_code, gfn))
3758 return RET_PF_EMULATE;
3759
3760 r = mmu_topup_memory_caches(vcpu);
3761 if (r)
3762 return r;
3763
3764 MMU_WARN_ON(!VALID_PAGE(vcpu->arch.mmu.root_hpa));
3765
3766
3767 return nonpaging_map(vcpu, gva & PAGE_MASK,
3768 error_code, gfn, prefault);
3769}
3770
3771static int kvm_arch_setup_async_pf(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu, gva_t gva, gfn_t gfn)
3772{
3773 struct kvm_arch_async_pf arch;
3774
3775 arch.token = (vcpu->arch.apf.id++ << 12) | vcpu->vcpu_id;
3776 arch.gfn = gfn;
3777 arch.direct_map = vcpu->arch.mmu.direct_map;
3778 arch.cr3 = vcpu->arch.mmu.get_cr3(vcpu);
3779
3780 return kvm_setup_async_pf(vcpu, gva, kvm_vcpu_gfn_to_hva(vcpu, gfn), &arch);
3781}
3782
3783bool kvm_can_do_async_pf(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu)
3784{
3785 if (unlikely(!lapic_in_kernel(vcpu) ||
3786 kvm_event_needs_reinjection(vcpu) ||
3787 vcpu->arch.exception.pending))
3788 return false;
3789
3790 if (!vcpu->arch.apf.delivery_as_pf_vmexit && is_guest_mode(vcpu))
3791 return false;
3792
3793 return kvm_x86_ops->interrupt_allowed(vcpu);
3794}
3795
3796static bool try_async_pf(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu, bool prefault, gfn_t gfn,
3797 gva_t gva, kvm_pfn_t *pfn, bool write, bool *writable)
3798{
3799 struct kvm_memory_slot *slot;
3800 bool async;
3801
3802 slot = kvm_vcpu_gfn_to_memslot(vcpu, gfn);
3803 async = false;
3804 *pfn = __gfn_to_pfn_memslot(slot, gfn, false, &async, write, writable);
3805 if (!async)
3806 return false; /* *pfn has correct page already */
3807
3808 if (!prefault && kvm_can_do_async_pf(vcpu)) {
3809 trace_kvm_try_async_get_page(gva, gfn);
3810 if (kvm_find_async_pf_gfn(vcpu, gfn)) {
3811 trace_kvm_async_pf_doublefault(gva, gfn);
3812 kvm_make_request(KVM_REQ_APF_HALT, vcpu);
3813 return true;
3814 } else if (kvm_arch_setup_async_pf(vcpu, gva, gfn))
3815 return true;
3816 }
3817
3818 *pfn = __gfn_to_pfn_memslot(slot, gfn, false, NULL, write, writable);
3819 return false;
3820}
3821
3822int kvm_handle_page_fault(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu, u64 error_code,
3823 u64 fault_address, char *insn, int insn_len,
3824 bool need_unprotect)
3825{
3826 int r = 1;
3827
3828 switch (vcpu->arch.apf.host_apf_reason) {
3829 default:
3830 trace_kvm_page_fault(fault_address, error_code);
3831
3832 if (need_unprotect && kvm_event_needs_reinjection(vcpu))
3833 kvm_mmu_unprotect_page_virt(vcpu, fault_address);
3834 r = kvm_mmu_page_fault(vcpu, fault_address, error_code, insn,
3835 insn_len);
3836 break;
3837 case KVM_PV_REASON_PAGE_NOT_PRESENT:
3838 vcpu->arch.apf.host_apf_reason = 0;
3839 local_irq_disable();
3840 kvm_async_pf_task_wait(fault_address, 0);
3841 local_irq_enable();
3842 break;
3843 case KVM_PV_REASON_PAGE_READY:
3844 vcpu->arch.apf.host_apf_reason = 0;
3845 local_irq_disable();
3846 kvm_async_pf_task_wake(fault_address);
3847 local_irq_enable();
3848 break;
3849 }
3850 return r;
3851}
3852EXPORT_SYMBOL_GPL(kvm_handle_page_fault);
3853
3854static bool
3855check_hugepage_cache_consistency(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu, gfn_t gfn, int level)
3856{
3857 int page_num = KVM_PAGES_PER_HPAGE(level);
3858
3859 gfn &= ~(page_num - 1);
3860
3861 return kvm_mtrr_check_gfn_range_consistency(vcpu, gfn, page_num);
3862}
3863
3864static int tdp_page_fault(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu, gva_t gpa, u32 error_code,
3865 bool prefault)
3866{
3867 kvm_pfn_t pfn;
3868 int r;
3869 int level;
3870 bool force_pt_level;
3871 gfn_t gfn = gpa >> PAGE_SHIFT;
3872 unsigned long mmu_seq;
3873 int write = error_code & PFERR_WRITE_MASK;
3874 bool map_writable;
3875
3876 MMU_WARN_ON(!VALID_PAGE(vcpu->arch.mmu.root_hpa));
3877
3878 if (page_fault_handle_page_track(vcpu, error_code, gfn))
3879 return RET_PF_EMULATE;
3880
3881 r = mmu_topup_memory_caches(vcpu);
3882 if (r)
3883 return r;
3884
3885 force_pt_level = !check_hugepage_cache_consistency(vcpu, gfn,
3886 PT_DIRECTORY_LEVEL);
3887 level = mapping_level(vcpu, gfn, &force_pt_level);
3888 if (likely(!force_pt_level)) {
3889 if (level > PT_DIRECTORY_LEVEL &&
3890 !check_hugepage_cache_consistency(vcpu, gfn, level))
3891 level = PT_DIRECTORY_LEVEL;
3892 gfn &= ~(KVM_PAGES_PER_HPAGE(level) - 1);
3893 }
3894
3895 if (fast_page_fault(vcpu, gpa, level, error_code))
3896 return RET_PF_RETRY;
3897
3898 mmu_seq = vcpu->kvm->mmu_notifier_seq;
3899 smp_rmb();
3900
3901 if (try_async_pf(vcpu, prefault, gfn, gpa, &pfn, write, &map_writable))
3902 return RET_PF_RETRY;
3903
3904 if (handle_abnormal_pfn(vcpu, 0, gfn, pfn, ACC_ALL, &r))
3905 return r;
3906
3907 spin_lock(&vcpu->kvm->mmu_lock);
3908 if (mmu_notifier_retry(vcpu->kvm, mmu_seq))
3909 goto out_unlock;
3910 if (make_mmu_pages_available(vcpu) < 0)
3911 goto out_unlock;
3912 if (likely(!force_pt_level))
3913 transparent_hugepage_adjust(vcpu, &gfn, &pfn, &level);
3914 r = __direct_map(vcpu, write, map_writable, level, gfn, pfn, prefault);
3915 spin_unlock(&vcpu->kvm->mmu_lock);
3916
3917 return r;
3918
3919out_unlock:
3920 spin_unlock(&vcpu->kvm->mmu_lock);
3921 kvm_release_pfn_clean(pfn);
3922 return RET_PF_RETRY;
3923}

3925static void nonpaging_init_context(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu,
3926 struct kvm_mmu *context)
3927{
3928 context->page_fault = nonpaging_page_fault;
3929 context->gva_to_gpa = nonpaging_gva_to_gpa;

3932 context->update_pte = nonpaging_update_pte;
3933 context->root_level = 0;
3934 context->shadow_root_level = PT32E_ROOT_LEVEL;
3935 context->root_hpa = INVALID_PAGE;
3936 context->direct_map = true;
3937 context->nx = false;
3938}

3955
3956static bool sync_mmio_spte(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu, u64 *sptep, gfn_t gfn,
3957 unsigned access, int *nr_present)
3958{
3959 if (unlikely(is_mmio_spte(*sptep))) {
3960 if (gfn != get_mmio_spte_gfn(*sptep)) {
3961 mmu_spte_clear_no_track(sptep);
3962 return true;
3963 }
3964
3965 (*nr_present)++;
3966 mark_mmio_spte(vcpu, sptep, gfn, access);
3967 return true;
3968 }
3969
3970 return false;
3971}
3972
3973static inline bool is_last_gpte(struct kvm_mmu *mmu,
3974 unsigned level, unsigned gpte)
3975{
3976 /*
3977 * The RHS has bit 7 set iff level < mmu->last_nonleaf_level.
3978 * If it is clear, there are no large pages at this level, so clear
3979 * PT_PAGE_SIZE_MASK in gpte if that is the case.
3980 */
3981 gpte &= level - mmu->last_nonleaf_level;
3982
3983 /*
3984 * PT_PAGE_TABLE_LEVEL always terminates. The RHS has bit 7 set
3985 * iff level <= PT_PAGE_TABLE_LEVEL, which for our purpose means
3986 * level == PT_PAGE_TABLE_LEVEL; set PT_PAGE_SIZE_MASK in gpte then.
3987 */
3988 gpte |= level - PT_PAGE_TABLE_LEVEL - 1;
3989
3990 return gpte & PT_PAGE_SIZE_MASK;
3991}

3993#define PTTYPE_EPT 18 /* arbitrary */
3994#define PTTYPE PTTYPE_EPT
3995#include "paging_tmpl.h"
3996#undef PTTYPE
3997
3998#define PTTYPE 64
3999#include "paging_tmpl.h"
4000#undef PTTYPE
4001
4002#define PTTYPE 32
4003#include "paging_tmpl.h"
4004#undef PTTYPE
4005
4006static void
4007__reset_rsvds_bits_mask(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu,
4008 struct rsvd_bits_validate *rsvd_check,
4009 int maxphyaddr, int level, bool nx, bool gbpages,
4010 bool pse, bool amd)
4011{
4012 u64 exb_bit_rsvd = 0;
4013 u64 gbpages_bit_rsvd = 0;
4014 u64 nonleaf_bit8_rsvd = 0;
4015
4016 rsvd_check->bad_mt_xwr = 0;
4017
4018 if (!nx)
4019 exb_bit_rsvd = rsvd_bits(63, 63);
4020 if (!gbpages)
4021 gbpages_bit_rsvd = rsvd_bits(7, 7);
4022
4023 /*
4024 * Non-leaf PML4Es and PDPEs reserve bit 8 (which would be the G bit for
4025 * leaf entries) on AMD CPUs only.
4026 */
4027 if (amd)
4028 nonleaf_bit8_rsvd = rsvd_bits(8, 8);
4029
4030 switch (level) {
4031 case PT32_ROOT_LEVEL:
4032 /* no rsvd bits for 2 level 4K page table entries */
4033 rsvd_check->rsvd_bits_mask[0][1] = 0;
4034 rsvd_check->rsvd_bits_mask[0][0] = 0;
4035 rsvd_check->rsvd_bits_mask[1][0] =
4036 rsvd_check->rsvd_bits_mask[0][0];
4037
4038 if (!pse) {
4039 rsvd_check->rsvd_bits_mask[1][1] = 0;
4040 break;
4041 }
4042
4043 if (is_cpuid_PSE36())
4044 /* 36bits PSE 4MB page */
4045 rsvd_check->rsvd_bits_mask[1][1] = rsvd_bits(17, 21);
4046 else
4047 /* 32 bits PSE 4MB page */
4048 rsvd_check->rsvd_bits_mask[1][1] = rsvd_bits(13, 21);
4049 break;
4050 case PT32E_ROOT_LEVEL:
4051 rsvd_check->rsvd_bits_mask[0][2] =
4052 rsvd_bits(maxphyaddr, 63) |
4053 rsvd_bits(5, 8) | rsvd_bits(1, 2); /* PDPTE */
4054 rsvd_check->rsvd_bits_mask[0][1] = exb_bit_rsvd |
4055 rsvd_bits(maxphyaddr, 62); /* PDE */
4056 rsvd_check->rsvd_bits_mask[0][0] = exb_bit_rsvd |
4057 rsvd_bits(maxphyaddr, 62); /* PTE */
4058 rsvd_check->rsvd_bits_mask[1][1] = exb_bit_rsvd |
4059 rsvd_bits(maxphyaddr, 62) |
4060 rsvd_bits(13, 20); /* large page */
4061 rsvd_check->rsvd_bits_mask[1][0] =
4062 rsvd_check->rsvd_bits_mask[0][0];
4063 break;
4064 case PT64_ROOT_5LEVEL:
4065 rsvd_check->rsvd_bits_mask[0][4] = exb_bit_rsvd |
4066 nonleaf_bit8_rsvd | rsvd_bits(7, 7) |
4067 rsvd_bits(maxphyaddr, 51);
4068 rsvd_check->rsvd_bits_mask[1][4] =
4069 rsvd_check->rsvd_bits_mask[0][4];
4070 case PT64_ROOT_4LEVEL:
4071 rsvd_check->rsvd_bits_mask[0][3] = exb_bit_rsvd |
4072 nonleaf_bit8_rsvd | rsvd_bits(7, 7) |
4073 rsvd_bits(maxphyaddr, 51);
4074 rsvd_check->rsvd_bits_mask[0][2] = exb_bit_rsvd |
4075 nonleaf_bit8_rsvd | gbpages_bit_rsvd |
4076 rsvd_bits(maxphyaddr, 51);
4077 rsvd_check->rsvd_bits_mask[0][1] = exb_bit_rsvd |
4078 rsvd_bits(maxphyaddr, 51);
4079 rsvd_check->rsvd_bits_mask[0][0] = exb_bit_rsvd |
4080 rsvd_bits(maxphyaddr, 51);
4081 rsvd_check->rsvd_bits_mask[1][3] =
4082 rsvd_check->rsvd_bits_mask[0][3];
4083 rsvd_check->rsvd_bits_mask[1][2] = exb_bit_rsvd |
4084 gbpages_bit_rsvd | rsvd_bits(maxphyaddr, 51) |
4085 rsvd_bits(13, 29);
4086 rsvd_check->rsvd_bits_mask[1][1] = exb_bit_rsvd |
4087 rsvd_bits(maxphyaddr, 51) |
4088 rsvd_bits(13, 20); /* large page */
4089 rsvd_check->rsvd_bits_mask[1][0] =
4090 rsvd_check->rsvd_bits_mask[0][0];
4091 break;
4092 }
4093}
4094
4095static void reset_rsvds_bits_mask(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu,
4096 struct kvm_mmu *context)
4097{
4098 __reset_rsvds_bits_mask(vcpu, &context->guest_rsvd_check,
4099 cpuid_maxphyaddr(vcpu), context->root_level,
4100 context->nx,
4101 guest_cpuid_has(vcpu, X86_FEATURE_GBPAGES),
4102 is_pse(vcpu), guest_cpuid_is_amd(vcpu));
4103}
4104
4105static void
4106__reset_rsvds_bits_mask_ept(struct rsvd_bits_validate *rsvd_check,
4107 int maxphyaddr, bool execonly)
4108{
4109 u64 bad_mt_xwr;
4110
4111 rsvd_check->rsvd_bits_mask[0][4] =
4112 rsvd_bits(maxphyaddr, 51) | rsvd_bits(3, 7);
4113 rsvd_check->rsvd_bits_mask[0][3] =
4114 rsvd_bits(maxphyaddr, 51) | rsvd_bits(3, 7);
4115 rsvd_check->rsvd_bits_mask[0][2] =
4116 rsvd_bits(maxphyaddr, 51) | rsvd_bits(3, 6);
4117 rsvd_check->rsvd_bits_mask[0][1] =
4118 rsvd_bits(maxphyaddr, 51) | rsvd_bits(3, 6);
4119 rsvd_check->rsvd_bits_mask[0][0] = rsvd_bits(maxphyaddr, 51);
4120
4121 /* large page */
4122 rsvd_check->rsvd_bits_mask[1][4] = rsvd_check->rsvd_bits_mask[0][4];
4123 rsvd_check->rsvd_bits_mask[1][3] = rsvd_check->rsvd_bits_mask[0][3];
4124 rsvd_check->rsvd_bits_mask[1][2] =
4125 rsvd_bits(maxphyaddr, 51) | rsvd_bits(12, 29);
4126 rsvd_check->rsvd_bits_mask[1][1] =
4127 rsvd_bits(maxphyaddr, 51) | rsvd_bits(12, 20);
4128 rsvd_check->rsvd_bits_mask[1][0] = rsvd_check->rsvd_bits_mask[0][0];
4129
4130 bad_mt_xwr = 0xFFull << (2 * 8); /* bits 3..5 must not be 2 */
4131 bad_mt_xwr |= 0xFFull << (3 * 8); /* bits 3..5 must not be 3 */
4132 bad_mt_xwr |= 0xFFull << (7 * 8); /* bits 3..5 must not be 7 */
4133 bad_mt_xwr |= REPEAT_BYTE(1ull << 2); /* bits 0..2 must not be 010 */
4134 bad_mt_xwr |= REPEAT_BYTE(1ull << 6); /* bits 0..2 must not be 110 */
4135 if (!execonly) {
4136 /* bits 0..2 must not be 100 unless VMX capabilities allow it */
4137 bad_mt_xwr |= REPEAT_BYTE(1ull << 4);
4138 }
4139 rsvd_check->bad_mt_xwr = bad_mt_xwr;
4140}
4141
4142static void reset_rsvds_bits_mask_ept(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu,
4143 struct kvm_mmu *context, bool execonly)
4144{
4145 __reset_rsvds_bits_mask_ept(&context->guest_rsvd_check,
4146 cpuid_maxphyaddr(vcpu), execonly);
4147}
4148
4149/*
4150 * the page table on host is the shadow page table for the page
4151 * table in guest or amd nested guest, its mmu features completely
4152 * follow the features in guest.
4153 */
4154void
4155reset_shadow_zero_bits_mask(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu, struct kvm_mmu *context)
4156{
4157 bool uses_nx = context->nx || context->base_role.smep_andnot_wp;
4158 struct rsvd_bits_validate *shadow_zero_check;
4159 int i;
4160
4161 /*
4162 * Passing "true" to the last argument is okay; it adds a check
4163 * on bit 8 of the SPTEs which KVM doesn't use anyway.
4164 */
4165 shadow_zero_check = &context->shadow_zero_check;
4166 __reset_rsvds_bits_mask(vcpu, shadow_zero_check,
4167 boot_cpu_data.x86_phys_bits,
4168 context->shadow_root_level, uses_nx,
4169 guest_cpuid_has(vcpu, X86_FEATURE_GBPAGES),
4170 is_pse(vcpu), true);
4171
4172 if (!shadow_me_mask)
4173 return;
4174
4175 for (i = context->shadow_root_level; --i >= 0;) {
4176 shadow_zero_check->rsvd_bits_mask[0][i] &= ~shadow_me_mask;
4177 shadow_zero_check->rsvd_bits_mask[1][i] &= ~shadow_me_mask;
4178 }
4179
4180}
4181EXPORT_SYMBOL_GPL(reset_shadow_zero_bits_mask);
4182
4183static inline bool boot_cpu_is_amd(void)
4184{
4185 WARN_ON_ONCE(!tdp_enabled);
4186 return shadow_x_mask == 0;
4187}
4188
4189/*
4190 * the direct page table on host, use as much mmu features as
4191 * possible, however, kvm currently does not do execution-protection.
4192 */
4193static void
4194reset_tdp_shadow_zero_bits_mask(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu,
4195 struct kvm_mmu *context)
4196{
4197 struct rsvd_bits_validate *shadow_zero_check;
4198 int i;
4199
4200 shadow_zero_check = &context->shadow_zero_check;
4201
4202 if (boot_cpu_is_amd())
4203 __reset_rsvds_bits_mask(vcpu, shadow_zero_check,
4204 boot_cpu_data.x86_phys_bits,
4205 context->shadow_root_level, false,
4206 boot_cpu_has(X86_FEATURE_GBPAGES),
4207 true, true);
4208 else
4209 __reset_rsvds_bits_mask_ept(shadow_zero_check,
4210 boot_cpu_data.x86_phys_bits,
4211 false);
4212
4213 if (!shadow_me_mask)
4214 return;
4215
4216 for (i = context->shadow_root_level; --i >= 0;) {
4217 shadow_zero_check->rsvd_bits_mask[0][i] &= ~shadow_me_mask;
4218 shadow_zero_check->rsvd_bits_mask[1][i] &= ~shadow_me_mask;
4219 }
4220}

4222/*
4223 * as the comments in reset_shadow_zero_bits_mask() except it
4224 * is the shadow page table for intel nested guest.
4225 */
4226static void
4227reset_ept_shadow_zero_bits_mask(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu,
4228 struct kvm_mmu *context, bool execonly)

4230 __reset_rsvds_bits_mask_ept(&context->shadow_zero_check,
