4233
4234#define BYTE_MASK(access) \
4235 ((1 & (access) ? 2 : 0) | \
4236 (2 & (access) ? 4 : 0) | \
4237 (3 & (access) ? 8 : 0) | \
4238 (4 & (access) ? 16 : 0) | \
4239 (5 & (access) ? 32 : 0) | \
4240 (6 & (access) ? 64 : 0) | \
4241 (7 & (access) ? 128 : 0))
4242
4243
4244static void update_permission_bitmask(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu,
4245 struct kvm_mmu *mmu, bool ept)
4246{
4247 unsigned byte;
4248
4249 const u8 x = BYTE_MASK(ACC_EXEC_MASK);
4250 const u8 w = BYTE_MASK(ACC_WRITE_MASK);
4251 const u8 u = BYTE_MASK(ACC_USER_MASK);
4252
4253 bool cr4_smep = kvm_read_cr4_bits(vcpu, X86_CR4_SMEP) != 0;
4254 bool cr4_smap = kvm_read_cr4_bits(vcpu, X86_CR4_SMAP) != 0;
4255 bool cr0_wp = is_write_protection(vcpu);
4256
4257 for (byte = 0; byte < ARRAY_SIZE(mmu->permissions); ++byte) {
4258 unsigned pfec = byte << 1;
4259
4260 /*
4261 * Each "*f" variable has a 1 bit for each UWX value
4262 * that causes a fault with the given PFEC.
4263 */
4264
4265 /* Faults from writes to non-writable pages */
4266 u8 wf = (pfec & PFERR_WRITE_MASK) ? ~w : 0;
4267 /* Faults from user mode accesses to supervisor pages */
4268 u8 uf = (pfec & PFERR_USER_MASK) ? ~u : 0;
4269 /* Faults from fetches of non-executable pages*/
4270 u8 ff = (pfec & PFERR_FETCH_MASK) ? ~x : 0;
4271 /* Faults from kernel mode fetches of user pages */
4272 u8 smepf = 0;
4273 /* Faults from kernel mode accesses of user pages */
4274 u8 smapf = 0;
4275
4276 if (!ept) {
4277 /* Faults from kernel mode accesses to user pages */
4278 u8 kf = (pfec & PFERR_USER_MASK) ? 0 : u;
4279
4280 /* Not really needed: !nx will cause pte.nx to fault */
4281 if (!mmu->nx)
4282 ff = 0;
4283
4284 /* Allow supervisor writes if !cr0.wp */
4285 if (!cr0_wp)
4286 wf = (pfec & PFERR_USER_MASK) ? wf : 0;
4287
4288 /* Disallow supervisor fetches of user code if cr4.smep */
4289 if (cr4_smep)
4290 smepf = (pfec & PFERR_FETCH_MASK) ? kf : 0;
4291
4292 /*
4293 * SMAP:kernel-mode data accesses from user-mode
4294 * mappings should fault. A fault is considered
4295 * as a SMAP violation if all of the following
4296 * conditions are ture:
4297 * - X86_CR4_SMAP is set in CR4
4298 * - A user page is accessed
4299 * - The access is not a fetch
4300 * - Page fault in kernel mode
4301 * - if CPL = 3 or X86_EFLAGS_AC is clear
4302 *
4303 * Here, we cover the first three conditions.
4304 * The fourth is computed dynamically in permission_fault();
4305 * PFERR_RSVD_MASK bit will be set in PFEC if the access is
4306 * *not* subject to SMAP restrictions.
4307 */
4308 if (cr4_smap)
4309 smapf = (pfec & (PFERR_RSVD_MASK|PFERR_FETCH_MASK)) ? 0 : kf;
4310 }
4311
4312 mmu->permissions[byte] = ff | uf | wf | smepf | smapf;
4313 }
4314}
4315
4316/*
4317* PKU is an additional mechanism by which the paging controls access to
4318* user-mode addresses based on the value in the PKRU register. Protection
4319* key violations are reported through a bit in the page fault error code.
4320* Unlike other bits of the error code, the PK bit is not known at the
4321* call site of e.g. gva_to_gpa; it must be computed directly in
4322* permission_fault based on two bits of PKRU, on some machine state (CR4,
4323* CR0, EFER, CPL), and on other bits of the error code and the page tables.
4324*
4325* In particular the following conditions come from the error code, the
4326* page tables and the machine state:
4327* - PK is always zero unless CR4.PKE=1 and EFER.LMA=1
4328* - PK is always zero if RSVD=1 (reserved bit set) or F=1 (instruction fetch)
4329* - PK is always zero if U=0 in the page tables
4330* - PKRU.WD is ignored if CR0.WP=0 and the access is a supervisor access.
4331*
4332* The PKRU bitmask caches the result of these four conditions. The error
4333* code (minus the P bit) and the page table's U bit form an index into the
4334* PKRU bitmask. Two bits of the PKRU bitmask are then extracted and ANDed
4335* with the two bits of the PKRU register corresponding to the protection key.
4336* For the first three conditions above the bits will be 00, thus masking
4337* away both AD and WD. For all reads or if the last condition holds, WD
4338* only will be masked away.
4339*/
4340static void update_pkru_bitmask(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu, struct kvm_mmu *mmu,
4341 bool ept)
4342{
4343 unsigned bit;
4344 bool wp;
4345
4346 if (ept) {
4347 mmu->pkru_mask = 0;
4348 return;
4349 }
4350
4351 /* PKEY is enabled only if CR4.PKE and EFER.LMA are both set. */
4352 if (!kvm_read_cr4_bits(vcpu, X86_CR4_PKE) || !is_long_mode(vcpu)) {
4353 mmu->pkru_mask = 0;
4354 return;
4355 }
4356
4357 wp = is_write_protection(vcpu);
4358
4359 for (bit = 0; bit < ARRAY_SIZE(mmu->permissions); ++bit) {
4360 unsigned pfec, pkey_bits;
4361 bool check_pkey, check_write, ff, uf, wf, pte_user;
4362
4363 pfec = bit << 1;
4364 ff = pfec & PFERR_FETCH_MASK;
4365 uf = pfec & PFERR_USER_MASK;
4366 wf = pfec & PFERR_WRITE_MASK;
4367
4368 /* PFEC.RSVD is replaced by ACC_USER_MASK. */
4369 pte_user = pfec & PFERR_RSVD_MASK;
4370
4371 /*
4372 * Only need to check the access which is not an
4373 * instruction fetch and is to a user page.
4374 */
4375 check_pkey = (!ff && pte_user);
4376 /*
4377 * write access is controlled by PKRU if it is a
4378 * user access or CR0.WP = 1.
4379 */
4380 check_write = check_pkey && wf && (uf || wp);
4381
4382 /* PKRU.AD stops both read and write access. */
4383 pkey_bits = !!check_pkey;
4384 /* PKRU.WD stops write access. */
4385 pkey_bits |= (!!check_write) << 1;
4386
4387 mmu->pkru_mask |= (pkey_bits & 3) << pfec;
4388 }
4389}
4390
4391static void update_last_nonleaf_level(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu, struct kvm_mmu *mmu)
4392{
4393 unsigned root_level = mmu->root_level;
4394
4395 mmu->last_nonleaf_level = root_level;
4396 if (root_level == PT32_ROOT_LEVEL && is_pse(vcpu))
4397 mmu->last_nonleaf_level++;
4398}
4399
4400static void paging64_init_context_common(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu,
4401 struct kvm_mmu *context,
4402 int level)
4403{
4404 context->nx = is_nx(vcpu);
4405 context->root_level = level;
4406
4407 reset_rsvds_bits_mask(vcpu, context);
4408 update_permission_bitmask(vcpu, context, false);
4409 update_pkru_bitmask(vcpu, context, false);
4410 update_last_nonleaf_level(vcpu, context);
4411
4412 MMU_WARN_ON(!is_pae(vcpu));
4413 context->page_fault = paging64_page_fault;
4414 context->gva_to_gpa = paging64_gva_to_gpa;
4415 context->sync_page = paging64_sync_page;
4416 context->invlpg = paging64_invlpg;
4417 context->update_pte = paging64_update_pte;
4418 context->shadow_root_level = level;
4419 context->root_hpa = INVALID_PAGE;
4420 context->direct_map = false;
4421}
4422
4423static void paging64_init_context(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu,
4424 struct kvm_mmu *context)
4425{
4426 int root_level = is_la57_mode(vcpu) ?
4427 PT64_ROOT_5LEVEL : PT64_ROOT_4LEVEL;
4428
4429 paging64_init_context_common(vcpu, context, root_level);
4430}
4431
4432static void paging32_init_context(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu,
4433 struct kvm_mmu *context)
4434{
4435 context->nx = false;
4436 context->root_level = PT32_ROOT_LEVEL;
4437
4438 reset_rsvds_bits_mask(vcpu, context);
4439 update_permission_bitmask(vcpu, context, false);
4440 update_pkru_bitmask(vcpu, context, false);
4441 update_last_nonleaf_level(vcpu, context);
4442
4443 context->page_fault = paging32_page_fault;
4444 context->gva_to_gpa = paging32_gva_to_gpa;
4445 context->sync_page = paging32_sync_page;
4446 context->invlpg = paging32_invlpg;
4447 context->update_pte = paging32_update_pte;
4448 context->shadow_root_level = PT32E_ROOT_LEVEL;
4449 context->root_hpa = INVALID_PAGE;
4450 context->direct_map = false;
4451}
4452
4453static void paging32E_init_context(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu,
4454 struct kvm_mmu *context)
4455{
4456 paging64_init_context_common(vcpu, context, PT32E_ROOT_LEVEL);
4457}
4458
4459static void init_kvm_tdp_mmu(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu)
4460{
4461 struct kvm_mmu *context = &vcpu->arch.mmu;
4462
4463 context->base_role.word = 0;
4464 context->base_role.smm = is_smm(vcpu);
4465 context->base_role.ad_disabled = (shadow_accessed_mask == 0);
4466 context->page_fault = tdp_page_fault;
4467 context->sync_page = nonpaging_sync_page;
4468 context->invlpg = nonpaging_invlpg;
4469 context->update_pte = nonpaging_update_pte;
4470 context->shadow_root_level = kvm_x86_ops->get_tdp_level(vcpu);
4471 context->root_hpa = INVALID_PAGE;
4472 context->direct_map = true;
4473 context->set_cr3 = kvm_x86_ops->set_tdp_cr3;
4474 context->get_cr3 = get_cr3;
4475 context->get_pdptr = kvm_pdptr_read;
4476 context->inject_page_fault = kvm_inject_page_fault;
4477
4478 if (!is_paging(vcpu)) {
4479 context->nx = false;
4480 context->gva_to_gpa = nonpaging_gva_to_gpa;
4481 context->root_level = 0;
4482 } else if (is_long_mode(vcpu)) {
4483 context->nx = is_nx(vcpu);
4484 context->root_level = is_la57_mode(vcpu) ?
4485 PT64_ROOT_5LEVEL : PT64_ROOT_4LEVEL;
4486 reset_rsvds_bits_mask(vcpu, context);
4487 context->gva_to_gpa = paging64_gva_to_gpa;
4488 } else if (is_pae(vcpu)) {
4489 context->nx = is_nx(vcpu);
4490 context->root_level = PT32E_ROOT_LEVEL;
4491 reset_rsvds_bits_mask(vcpu, context);
4492 context->gva_to_gpa = paging64_gva_to_gpa;
4493 } else {
4494 context->nx = false;
4495 context->root_level = PT32_ROOT_LEVEL;
4496 reset_rsvds_bits_mask(vcpu, context);
4497 context->gva_to_gpa = paging32_gva_to_gpa;
4498 }
4499
4500 update_permission_bitmask(vcpu, context, false);
4501 update_pkru_bitmask(vcpu, context, false);
4502 update_last_nonleaf_level(vcpu, context);
4503 reset_tdp_shadow_zero_bits_mask(vcpu, context);
4504}
4505
4506void kvm_init_shadow_mmu(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu)
4507{
4508 bool smep = kvm_read_cr4_bits(vcpu, X86_CR4_SMEP);
4509 bool smap = kvm_read_cr4_bits(vcpu, X86_CR4_SMAP);
4510 struct kvm_mmu *context = &vcpu->arch.mmu;
4511
4512 MMU_WARN_ON(VALID_PAGE(context->root_hpa));
4513
4514 if (!is_paging(vcpu))
4515 nonpaging_init_context(vcpu, context);
4516 else if (is_long_mode(vcpu))
4517 paging64_init_context(vcpu, context);
4518 else if (is_pae(vcpu))
4519 paging32E_init_context(vcpu, context);
4520 else
4521 paging32_init_context(vcpu, context);
4522
4523 context->base_role.nxe = is_nx(vcpu);
4524 context->base_role.cr4_pae = !!is_pae(vcpu);
4525 context->base_role.cr0_wp = is_write_protection(vcpu);
4526 context->base_role.smep_andnot_wp
4527 = smep && !is_write_protection(vcpu);
4528 context->base_role.smap_andnot_wp
4529 = smap && !is_write_protection(vcpu);
4530 context->base_role.smm = is_smm(vcpu);
4531 reset_shadow_zero_bits_mask(vcpu, context);
4532}
4533EXPORT_SYMBOL_GPL(kvm_init_shadow_mmu);
4534
4535void kvm_init_shadow_ept_mmu(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu, bool execonly,
4536 bool accessed_dirty)
4537{
4538 struct kvm_mmu *context = &vcpu->arch.mmu;
4539
4540 MMU_WARN_ON(VALID_PAGE(context->root_hpa));
4541
4542 context->shadow_root_level = PT64_ROOT_4LEVEL;
4543
4544 context->nx = true;
4545 context->ept_ad = accessed_dirty;
4546 context->page_fault = ept_page_fault;
4547 context->gva_to_gpa = ept_gva_to_gpa;
4548 context->sync_page = ept_sync_page;
4549 context->invlpg = ept_invlpg;
4550 context->update_pte = ept_update_pte;
4551 context->root_level = PT64_ROOT_4LEVEL;
4552 context->root_hpa = INVALID_PAGE;
4553 context->direct_map = false;
4554 context->base_role.ad_disabled = !accessed_dirty;
4555
4556 update_permission_bitmask(vcpu, context, true);
4557 update_pkru_bitmask(vcpu, context, true);
4558 update_last_nonleaf_level(vcpu, context);
4559 reset_rsvds_bits_mask_ept(vcpu, context, execonly);
4560 reset_ept_shadow_zero_bits_mask(vcpu, context, execonly);
4561}
4562EXPORT_SYMBOL_GPL(kvm_init_shadow_ept_mmu);
4563
4564static void init_kvm_softmmu(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu)
4565{
4566 struct kvm_mmu *context = &vcpu->arch.mmu;
4567
4568 kvm_init_shadow_mmu(vcpu);
4569 context->set_cr3 = kvm_x86_ops->set_cr3;
4570 context->get_cr3 = get_cr3;
4571 context->get_pdptr = kvm_pdptr_read;
4572 context->inject_page_fault = kvm_inject_page_fault;
4573}
4574
4575static void init_kvm_nested_mmu(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu)
4576{
4577 struct kvm_mmu *g_context = &vcpu->arch.nested_mmu;
4578
4579 g_context->get_cr3 = get_cr3;
4580 g_context->get_pdptr = kvm_pdptr_read;
4581 g_context->inject_page_fault = kvm_inject_page_fault;
4582
4583 /*
4584 * Note that arch.mmu.gva_to_gpa translates l2_gpa to l1_gpa using
4585 * L1's nested page tables (e.g. EPT12). The nested translation
4586 * of l2_gva to l1_gpa is done by arch.nested_mmu.gva_to_gpa using
4587 * L2's page tables as the first level of translation and L1's
4588 * nested page tables as the second level of translation. Basically
4589 * the gva_to_gpa functions between mmu and nested_mmu are swapped.
4590 */
4591 if (!is_paging(vcpu)) {
4592 g_context->nx = false;
4593 g_context->root_level = 0;
4594 g_context->gva_to_gpa = nonpaging_gva_to_gpa_nested;
4595 } else if (is_long_mode(vcpu)) {
4596 g_context->nx = is_nx(vcpu);
4597 g_context->root_level = is_la57_mode(vcpu) ?
4598 PT64_ROOT_5LEVEL : PT64_ROOT_4LEVEL;
4599 reset_rsvds_bits_mask(vcpu, g_context);
4600 g_context->gva_to_gpa = paging64_gva_to_gpa_nested;
4601 } else if (is_pae(vcpu)) {
4602 g_context->nx = is_nx(vcpu);
4603 g_context->root_level = PT32E_ROOT_LEVEL;
4604 reset_rsvds_bits_mask(vcpu, g_context);
4605 g_context->gva_to_gpa = paging64_gva_to_gpa_nested;
4606 } else {
4607 g_context->nx = false;
4608 g_context->root_level = PT32_ROOT_LEVEL;
4609 reset_rsvds_bits_mask(vcpu, g_context);
4610 g_context->gva_to_gpa = paging32_gva_to_gpa_nested;
4611 }
4612
4613 update_permission_bitmask(vcpu, g_context, false);
4614 update_pkru_bitmask(vcpu, g_context, false);
4615 update_last_nonleaf_level(vcpu, g_context);
4616}
4617
4618static void init_kvm_mmu(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu)
4619{
4620 if (mmu_is_nested(vcpu))
4621 init_kvm_nested_mmu(vcpu);
4622 else if (tdp_enabled)
4623 init_kvm_tdp_mmu(vcpu);
4624 else
4625 init_kvm_softmmu(vcpu);
4626}
4627
4628void kvm_mmu_reset_context(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu)
4629{
4630 kvm_mmu_unload(vcpu);
4631 init_kvm_mmu(vcpu);
4632}
4633EXPORT_SYMBOL_GPL(kvm_mmu_reset_context);
4634
4635int kvm_mmu_load(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu)
4636{
4637 int r;
4638
4639 r = mmu_topup_memory_caches(vcpu);
4640 if (r)
4641 goto out;
4642 r = mmu_alloc_roots(vcpu);
4643 kvm_mmu_sync_roots(vcpu);
4644 if (r)
4645 goto out;
4646 /* set_cr3() should ensure TLB has been flushed */
4647 vcpu->arch.mmu.set_cr3(vcpu, vcpu->arch.mmu.root_hpa);
4648out:
4649 return r;
4650}
4651EXPORT_SYMBOL_GPL(kvm_mmu_load);
4652
4653void kvm_mmu_unload(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu)
4654{
4655 mmu_free_roots(vcpu);
4656 WARN_ON(VALID_PAGE(vcpu->arch.mmu.root_hpa));
4657}
4658EXPORT_SYMBOL_GPL(kvm_mmu_unload);
4659
4660static void mmu_pte_write_new_pte(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu,
4661 struct kvm_mmu_page *sp, u64 *spte,
4662 const void *new)
4663{
4664 if (sp->role.level != PT_PAGE_TABLE_LEVEL) {
4665 ++vcpu->kvm->stat.mmu_pde_zapped;
4666 return;
4667 }
4668
4669 ++vcpu->kvm->stat.mmu_pte_updated;
4670 vcpu->arch.mmu.update_pte(vcpu, sp, spte, new);
4671}
4672
4673static bool need_remote_flush(u64 old, u64 new)
4674{
4675 if (!is_shadow_present_pte(old))
4676 return false;
4677 if (!is_shadow_present_pte(new))
4678 return true;
4679 if ((old ^ new) & PT64_BASE_ADDR_MASK)
4680 return true;
4681 old ^= shadow_nx_mask;
4682 new ^= shadow_nx_mask;
4683 return (old & ~new & PT64_PERM_MASK) != 0;
4684}
4685
4686static u64 mmu_pte_write_fetch_gpte(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu, gpa_t *gpa,
4687 const u8 *new, int *bytes)
4688{
4689 u64 gentry;
4690 int r;
4691
4692 /*
4693 * Assume that the pte write on a page table of the same type
4694 * as the current vcpu paging mode since we update the sptes only
4695 * when they have the same mode.
4696 */
4697 if (is_pae(vcpu) && *bytes == 4) {
4698 /* Handle a 32-bit guest writing two halves of a 64-bit gpte */
4699 *gpa &= ~(gpa_t)7;
4700 *bytes = 8;
4701 r = kvm_vcpu_read_guest(vcpu, *gpa, &gentry, 8);
4702 if (r)
4703 gentry = 0;
4704 new = (const u8 *)&gentry;
4705 }
4706
4707 switch (*bytes) {
4708 case 4:
4709 gentry = *(const u32 *)new;
4710 break;
4711 case 8:
4712 gentry = *(const u64 *)new;
4713 break;
4714 default:
4715 gentry = 0;
4716 break;
4717 }
4718
4719 return gentry;
4720}
4721
4722/*
4723 * If we're seeing too many writes to a page, it may no longer be a page table,
4724 * or we may be forking, in which case it is better to unmap the page.
4725 */
4726static bool detect_write_flooding(struct kvm_mmu_page *sp)
4727{
4728 /*
4729 * Skip write-flooding detected for the sp whose level is 1, because
4730 * it can become unsync, then the guest page is not write-protected.
4731 */
4732 if (sp->role.level == PT_PAGE_TABLE_LEVEL)
4733 return false;
4734
4735 atomic_inc(&sp->write_flooding_count);
4736 return atomic_read(&sp->write_flooding_count) >= 3;
4737}
4738
4739/*
4740 * Misaligned accesses are too much trouble to fix up; also, they usually
4741 * indicate a page is not used as a page table.
4742 */
4743static bool detect_write_misaligned(struct kvm_mmu_page *sp, gpa_t gpa,
4744 int bytes)
4745{
4746 unsigned offset, pte_size, misaligned;
4747
4748 pgprintk("misaligned: gpa %llx bytes %d role %x\n",
4749 gpa, bytes, sp->role.word);
4750
4751 offset = offset_in_page(gpa);
4752 pte_size = sp->role.cr4_pae ? 8 : 4;
4753
4754 /*
4755 * Sometimes, the OS only writes the last one bytes to update status
4756 * bits, for example, in linux, andb instruction is used in clear_bit().
4757 */
4758 if (!(offset & (pte_size - 1)) && bytes == 1)
4759 return false;
4760
4761 misaligned = (offset ^ (offset + bytes - 1)) & ~(pte_size - 1);
4762 misaligned |= bytes < 4;
4763
4764 return misaligned;
4765}
4766
4767static u64 *get_written_sptes(struct kvm_mmu_page *sp, gpa_t gpa, int *nspte)
4768{
4769 unsigned page_offset, quadrant;
4770 u64 *spte;
4771 int level;
4772
4773 page_offset = offset_in_page(gpa);
4774 level = sp->role.level;
4775 *nspte = 1;
4776 if (!sp->role.cr4_pae) {
4777 page_offset <<= 1; /* 32->64 */
4778 /*
4779 * A 32-bit pde maps 4MB while the shadow pdes map
4780 * only 2MB. So we need to double the offset again
4781 * and zap two pdes instead of one.
4782 */
4783 if (level == PT32_ROOT_LEVEL) {
4784 page_offset &= ~7; /* kill rounding error */
4785 page_offset <<= 1;
4786 *nspte = 2;
4787 }
4788 quadrant = page_offset >> PAGE_SHIFT;
4789 page_offset &= ~PAGE_MASK;
4790 if (quadrant != sp->role.quadrant)
4791 return NULL;
4792 }
4793
4794 spte = &sp->spt[page_offset / sizeof(*spte)];
4795 return spte;
4796}
4797
4798static void kvm_mmu_pte_write(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu, gpa_t gpa,
4799 const u8 *new, int bytes,
4800 struct kvm_page_track_notifier_node *node)
4801{
4802 gfn_t gfn = gpa >> PAGE_SHIFT;
4803 struct kvm_mmu_page *sp;
4804 LIST_HEAD(invalid_list);
4805 u64 entry, gentry, *spte;
4806 int npte;
4807 bool remote_flush, local_flush;
4808 union kvm_mmu_page_role mask = { };
4809
4810 mask.cr0_wp = 1;
4811 mask.cr4_pae = 1;
4812 mask.nxe = 1;
4813 mask.smep_andnot_wp = 1;
4814 mask.smap_andnot_wp = 1;
4815 mask.smm = 1;
4816 mask.ad_disabled = 1;
4817
4818 /*
4819 * If we don't have indirect shadow pages, it means no page is
4820 * write-protected, so we can exit simply.
4821 */
4822 if (!ACCESS_ONCE(vcpu->kvm->arch.indirect_shadow_pages))
4823 return;
4824
4825 remote_flush = local_flush = false;
4826
4827 pgprintk("%s: gpa %llx bytes %d\n", __func__, gpa, bytes);
4828
4829 gentry = mmu_pte_write_fetch_gpte(vcpu, &gpa, new, &bytes);
4830
4831 /*
4832 * No need to care whether allocation memory is successful
4833 * or not since pte prefetch is skiped if it does not have
4834 * enough objects in the cache.
4835 */
4836 mmu_topup_memory_caches(vcpu);
4837
4838 spin_lock(&vcpu->kvm->mmu_lock);
4839 ++vcpu->kvm->stat.mmu_pte_write;
4840 kvm_mmu_audit(vcpu, AUDIT_PRE_PTE_WRITE);
4841
4842 for_each_gfn_indirect_valid_sp(vcpu->kvm, sp, gfn) {
4843 if (detect_write_misaligned(sp, gpa, bytes) ||
4844 detect_write_flooding(sp)) {
4845 kvm_mmu_prepare_zap_page(vcpu->kvm, sp, &invalid_list);
4846 ++vcpu->kvm->stat.mmu_flooded;
4847 continue;
4848 }
4849
4850 spte = get_written_sptes(sp, gpa, &npte);
4851 if (!spte)
4852 continue;
4853
4854 local_flush = true;
4855 while (npte--) {
4856 entry = *spte;
4857 mmu_page_zap_pte(vcpu->kvm, sp, spte);
4858 if (gentry &&
4859 !((sp->role.word ^ vcpu->arch.mmu.base_role.word)
4860 & mask.word) && rmap_can_add(vcpu))
4861 mmu_pte_write_new_pte(vcpu, sp, spte, &gentry);
4862 if (need_remote_flush(entry, *spte))
4863 remote_flush = true;
4864 ++spte;
4865 }
4866 }
4867 kvm_mmu_flush_or_zap(vcpu, &invalid_list, remote_flush, local_flush);
4868 kvm_mmu_audit(vcpu, AUDIT_POST_PTE_WRITE);
4869 spin_unlock(&vcpu->kvm->mmu_lock);
4870}
4871
4872int kvm_mmu_unprotect_page_virt(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu, gva_t gva)
4873{
4874 gpa_t gpa;
4875 int r;
4876
4877 if (vcpu->arch.mmu.direct_map)
4878 return 0;
4879
4880 gpa = kvm_mmu_gva_to_gpa_read(vcpu, gva, NULL);
4881
4882 r = kvm_mmu_unprotect_page(vcpu->kvm, gpa >> PAGE_SHIFT);
4883
4884 return r;
4885}
4886EXPORT_SYMBOL_GPL(kvm_mmu_unprotect_page_virt);
4887
4888static int make_mmu_pages_available(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu)
4889{
4890 LIST_HEAD(invalid_list);
4891
4892 if (likely(kvm_mmu_available_pages(vcpu->kvm) >= KVM_MIN_FREE_MMU_PAGES))
4893 return 0;
4894
4895 while (kvm_mmu_available_pages(vcpu->kvm) < KVM_REFILL_PAGES) {
4896 if (!prepare_zap_oldest_mmu_page(vcpu->kvm, &invalid_list))
4897 break;
4898
4899 ++vcpu->kvm->stat.mmu_recycled;
4900 }
4901 kvm_mmu_commit_zap_page(vcpu->kvm, &invalid_list);
4902
4903 if (!kvm_mmu_available_pages(vcpu->kvm))
4904 return -ENOSPC;
4905 return 0;
4906}
4907
4908int kvm_mmu_page_fault(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu, gva_t cr2, u64 error_code,
4909 void *insn, int insn_len)
4910{
4911 int r, emulation_type = EMULTYPE_RETRY;
4912 enum emulation_result er;
4913 bool direct = vcpu->arch.mmu.direct_map;
4914
4915 /* With shadow page tables, fault_address contains a GVA or nGPA. */
4916 if (vcpu->arch.mmu.direct_map) {
4917 vcpu->arch.gpa_available = true;
4918 vcpu->arch.gpa_val = cr2;
4919 }
4920
4921 r = RET_PF_INVALID;
4922 if (unlikely(error_code & PFERR_RSVD_MASK)) {
4923 r = handle_mmio_page_fault(vcpu, cr2, direct);
4924 if (r == RET_PF_EMULATE) {
4925 emulation_type = 0;
4926 goto emulate;
4927 }
4928 }
4929
4930 if (r == RET_PF_INVALID) {
4931 r = vcpu->arch.mmu.page_fault(vcpu, cr2, lower_32_bits(error_code),
4932 false);
4933 WARN_ON(r == RET_PF_INVALID);
4934 }
4935
4936 if (r == RET_PF_RETRY)
4937 return 1;
4938 if (r < 0)
4939 return r;
4940
4941 /*
4942 * Before emulating the instruction, check if the error code
4943 * was due to a RO violation while translating the guest page.
4944 * This can occur when using nested virtualization with nested
4945 * paging in both guests. If true, we simply unprotect the page
4946 * and resume the guest.
4947 */
4948 if (vcpu->arch.mmu.direct_map &&
4949 (error_code & PFERR_NESTED_GUEST_PAGE) == PFERR_NESTED_GUEST_PAGE) {
4950 kvm_mmu_unprotect_page(vcpu->kvm, gpa_to_gfn(cr2));
4951 return 1;
4952 }
4953
4954 if (mmio_info_in_cache(vcpu, cr2, direct))
4955 emulation_type = 0;
4956emulate:
4957 er = x86_emulate_instruction(vcpu, cr2, emulation_type, insn, insn_len);
4958
4959 switch (er) {
4960 case EMULATE_DONE:
4961 return 1;
4962 case EMULATE_USER_EXIT:
4963 ++vcpu->stat.mmio_exits;
4964 /* fall through */
4965 case EMULATE_FAIL:
4966 return 0;
4967 default:
4968 BUG();
4969 }
4970}
4971EXPORT_SYMBOL_GPL(kvm_mmu_page_fault);
4972
4973void kvm_mmu_invlpg(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu, gva_t gva)
4974{
4975 vcpu->arch.mmu.invlpg(vcpu, gva);
4976 kvm_make_request(KVM_REQ_TLB_FLUSH, vcpu);
4977 ++vcpu->stat.invlpg;
4978}
4979EXPORT_SYMBOL_GPL(kvm_mmu_invlpg);

4983 tdp_enabled = true;
4984}

4993static void free_mmu_pages(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu)
4994{
4995 free_page((unsigned long)vcpu->arch.mmu.pae_root);
4996 if (vcpu->arch.mmu.lm_root != NULL)
4997 free_page((unsigned long)vcpu->arch.mmu.lm_root);
4998}
4999
5000static int alloc_mmu_pages(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu)
5001{
5002 struct page *page;
5003 int i;
5004
5005 /*
5006 * When emulating 32-bit mode, cr3 is only 32 bits even on x86_64.
5007 * Therefore we need to allocate shadow page tables in the first
5008 * 4GB of memory, which happens to fit the DMA32 zone.
5009 */
5010 page = alloc_page(GFP_KERNEL | __GFP_DMA32);
5011 if (!page)
5012 return -ENOMEM;
5013
5014 vcpu->arch.mmu.pae_root = page_address(page);
5015 for (i = 0; i < 4; ++i)
5016 vcpu->arch.mmu.pae_root[i] = INVALID_PAGE;
5017
5018 return 0;
5019}

5021int kvm_mmu_create(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu)
5022{
5023 vcpu->arch.walk_mmu = &vcpu->arch.mmu;
5024 vcpu->arch.mmu.root_hpa = INVALID_PAGE;
5025 vcpu->arch.mmu.translate_gpa = translate_gpa;
5026 vcpu->arch.nested_mmu.translate_gpa = translate_nested_gpa;
5027
5028 return alloc_mmu_pages(vcpu);
5029}

5031void kvm_mmu_setup(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu)
5032{
5033 MMU_WARN_ON(VALID_PAGE(vcpu->arch.mmu.root_hpa));

5035 init_kvm_mmu(vcpu);
5036}

5038static void kvm_mmu_invalidate_zap_pages_in_memslot(struct kvm *kvm,
5039 struct kvm_memory_slot *slot,
5040 struct kvm_page_track_notifier_node *node)

5042 kvm_mmu_invalidate_zap_all_pages(kvm);

5060
5061/* The return value indicates if tlb flush on all vcpus is needed. */
5062typedef bool (*slot_level_handler) (struct kvm *kvm, struct kvm_rmap_head *rmap_head);
5063
5064/* The caller should hold mmu-lock before calling this function. */
5065static __always_inline bool
5066slot_handle_level_range(struct kvm *kvm, struct kvm_memory_slot *memslot,
5067 slot_level_handler fn, int start_level, int end_level,
5068 gfn_t start_gfn, gfn_t end_gfn, bool lock_flush_tlb)
5069{
5070 struct slot_rmap_walk_iterator iterator;
5071 bool flush = false;
5072
5073 for_each_slot_rmap_range(memslot, start_level, end_level, start_gfn,
5074 end_gfn, &iterator) {
5075 if (iterator.rmap)
5076 flush |= fn(kvm, iterator.rmap);
5077
5078 if (need_resched() || spin_needbreak(&kvm->mmu_lock)) {
5079 if (flush && lock_flush_tlb) {
5080 kvm_flush_remote_tlbs(kvm);
5081 flush = false;
5082 }
5083 cond_resched_lock(&kvm->mmu_lock);
5084 }
5085 }
5086
5087 if (flush && lock_flush_tlb) {
5088 kvm_flush_remote_tlbs(kvm);
5089 flush = false;
5090 }
5091
5092 return flush;
5093}
5094
5095static __always_inline bool
5096slot_handle_level(struct kvm *kvm, struct kvm_memory_slot *memslot,
5097 slot_level_handler fn, int start_level, int end_level,
5098 bool lock_flush_tlb)
5099{
5100 return slot_handle_level_range(kvm, memslot, fn, start_level,
5101 end_level, memslot->base_gfn,
5102 memslot->base_gfn + memslot->npages - 1,
5103 lock_flush_tlb);
5104}
5105
5106static __always_inline bool
5107slot_handle_all_level(struct kvm *kvm, struct kvm_memory_slot *memslot,
5108 slot_level_handler fn, bool lock_flush_tlb)
5109{
5110 return slot_handle_level(kvm, memslot, fn, PT_PAGE_TABLE_LEVEL,
5111 PT_MAX_HUGEPAGE_LEVEL, lock_flush_tlb);
5112}
5113
5114static __always_inline bool
5115slot_handle_large_level(struct kvm *kvm, struct kvm_memory_slot *memslot,
5116 slot_level_handler fn, bool lock_flush_tlb)
5117{
5118 return slot_handle_level(kvm, memslot, fn, PT_PAGE_TABLE_LEVEL + 1,
5119 PT_MAX_HUGEPAGE_LEVEL, lock_flush_tlb);
5120}
5121
5122static __always_inline bool
5123slot_handle_leaf(struct kvm *kvm, struct kvm_memory_slot *memslot,
5124 slot_level_handler fn, bool lock_flush_tlb)
5125{
5126 return slot_handle_level(kvm, memslot, fn, PT_PAGE_TABLE_LEVEL,
5127 PT_PAGE_TABLE_LEVEL, lock_flush_tlb);
5128}
5129
5130void kvm_zap_gfn_range(struct kvm *kvm, gfn_t gfn_start, gfn_t gfn_end)
5131{
5132 struct kvm_memslots *slots;
5133 struct kvm_memory_slot *memslot;
5134 int i;
5135
5136 spin_lock(&kvm->mmu_lock);
5137 for (i = 0; i < KVM_ADDRESS_SPACE_NUM; i++) {
5138 slots = __kvm_memslots(kvm, i);
5139 kvm_for_each_memslot(memslot, slots) {
5140 gfn_t start, end;
5141
5142 start = max(gfn_start, memslot->base_gfn);
5143 end = min(gfn_end, memslot->base_gfn + memslot->npages);
5144 if (start >= end)
5145 continue;
5146
5147 slot_handle_level_range(kvm, memslot, kvm_zap_rmapp,
5148 PT_PAGE_TABLE_LEVEL, PT_MAX_HUGEPAGE_LEVEL,
5149 start, end - 1, true);
5150 }
5151 }
5152
5153 spin_unlock(&kvm->mmu_lock);
5154}
5155
5156static bool slot_rmap_write_protect(struct kvm *kvm,
5157 struct kvm_rmap_head *rmap_head)
5158{
5159 return __rmap_write_protect(kvm, rmap_head, false);
5160}
5161
5162void kvm_mmu_slot_remove_write_access(struct kvm *kvm,
5163 struct kvm_memory_slot *memslot)
5164{
5165 bool flush;
5166
5167 spin_lock(&kvm->mmu_lock);
5168 flush = slot_handle_all_level(kvm, memslot, slot_rmap_write_protect,
5169 false);
5170 spin_unlock(&kvm->mmu_lock);
5171
5172 /*
5173 * kvm_mmu_slot_remove_write_access() and kvm_vm_ioctl_get_dirty_log()
5174 * which do tlb flush out of mmu-lock should be serialized by
5175 * kvm->slots_lock otherwise tlb flush would be missed.
5176 */
5177 lockdep_assert_held(&kvm->slots_lock);
5178
5179 /*
5180 * We can flush all the TLBs out of the mmu lock without TLB
5181 * corruption since we just change the spte from writable to
5182 * readonly so that we only need to care the case of changing
5183 * spte from present to present (changing the spte from present
5184 * to nonpresent will flush all the TLBs immediately), in other
5185 * words, the only case we care is mmu_spte_update() where we
5186 * haved checked SPTE_HOST_WRITEABLE | SPTE_MMU_WRITEABLE
5187 * instead of PT_WRITABLE_MASK, that means it does not depend
5188 * on PT_WRITABLE_MASK anymore.
5189 */
5190 if (flush)
5191 kvm_flush_remote_tlbs(kvm);
5192}
5193
5194static bool kvm_mmu_zap_collapsible_spte(struct kvm *kvm,
5195 struct kvm_rmap_head *rmap_head)
5196{
5197 u64 *sptep;
5198 struct rmap_iterator iter;
5199 int need_tlb_flush = 0;
5200 kvm_pfn_t pfn;
5201 struct kvm_mmu_page *sp;
5202
5203restart:
5204 for_each_rmap_spte(rmap_head, &iter, sptep) {
5205 sp = page_header(__pa(sptep));
5206 pfn = spte_to_pfn(*sptep);
5207
5208 /*
5209 * We cannot do huge page mapping for indirect shadow pages,
5210 * which are found on the last rmap (level = 1) when not using
5211 * tdp; such shadow pages are synced with the page table in
5212 * the guest, and the guest page table is using 4K page size
5213 * mapping if the indirect sp has level = 1.
5214 */
5215 if (sp->role.direct &&
5216 !kvm_is_reserved_pfn(pfn) &&
5217 PageTransCompoundMap(pfn_to_page(pfn))) {
5218 drop_spte(kvm, sptep);
5219 need_tlb_flush = 1;
5220 goto restart;
5221 }
5222 }
5223
5224 return need_tlb_flush;
5225}
5226
5227void kvm_mmu_zap_collapsible_sptes(struct kvm *kvm,
5228 const struct kvm_memory_slot *memslot)
5229{
5230 /* FIXME: const-ify all uses of struct kvm_memory_slot. */
5231 spin_lock(&kvm->mmu_lock);
5232 slot_handle_leaf(kvm, (struct kvm_memory_slot *)memslot,
5233 kvm_mmu_zap_collapsible_spte, true);
5234 spin_unlock(&kvm->mmu_lock);
5235}
5236
5237void kvm_mmu_slot_leaf_clear_dirty(struct kvm *kvm,
5238 struct kvm_memory_slot *memslot)
5239{
5240 bool flush;
5241
5242 spin_lock(&kvm->mmu_lock);
5243 flush = slot_handle_leaf(kvm, memslot, __rmap_clear_dirty, false);
5244 spin_unlock(&kvm->mmu_lock);
5245
5246 lockdep_assert_held(&kvm->slots_lock);
5247
5248 /*
5249 * It's also safe to flush TLBs out of mmu lock here as currently this
5250 * function is only used for dirty logging, in which case flushing TLB
5251 * out of mmu lock also guarantees no dirty pages will be lost in
5252 * dirty_bitmap.
5253 */
5254 if (flush)
5255 kvm_flush_remote_tlbs(kvm);
5256}
5257EXPORT_SYMBOL_GPL(kvm_mmu_slot_leaf_clear_dirty);
5258
5259void kvm_mmu_slot_largepage_remove_write_access(struct kvm *kvm,
5260 struct kvm_memory_slot *memslot)
5261{
5262 bool flush;
5263
5264 spin_lock(&kvm->mmu_lock);
5265 flush = slot_handle_large_level(kvm, memslot, slot_rmap_write_protect,
5266 false);
5267 spin_unlock(&kvm->mmu_lock);
5268
5269 /* see kvm_mmu_slot_remove_write_access */
5270 lockdep_assert_held(&kvm->slots_lock);
5271
5272 if (flush)
5273 kvm_flush_remote_tlbs(kvm);
5274}
5275EXPORT_SYMBOL_GPL(kvm_mmu_slot_largepage_remove_write_access);
5276
5277void kvm_mmu_slot_set_dirty(struct kvm *kvm,
5278 struct kvm_memory_slot *memslot)
5279{
5280 bool flush;
5281
5282 spin_lock(&kvm->mmu_lock);
5283 flush = slot_handle_all_level(kvm, memslot, __rmap_set_dirty, false);
5284 spin_unlock(&kvm->mmu_lock);
5285
5286 lockdep_assert_held(&kvm->slots_lock);
5287
5288 /* see kvm_mmu_slot_leaf_clear_dirty */
5289 if (flush)
5290 kvm_flush_remote_tlbs(kvm);
5291}
5292EXPORT_SYMBOL_GPL(kvm_mmu_slot_set_dirty);
5293
5294#define BATCH_ZAP_PAGES 10
5295static void kvm_zap_obsolete_pages(struct kvm *kvm)
5296{
5297 struct kvm_mmu_page *sp, *node;
5298 int batch = 0;
5299
5300restart:
5301 list_for_each_entry_safe_reverse(sp, node,
5302 &kvm->arch.active_mmu_pages, link) {
5303 int ret;
5304
5305 /*
5306 * No obsolete page exists before new created page since
5307 * active_mmu_pages is the FIFO list.
5308 */
5309 if (!is_obsolete_sp(kvm, sp))
5310 break;
5311
5312 /*
5313 * Since we are reversely walking the list and the invalid
5314 * list will be moved to the head, skip the invalid page
5315 * can help us to avoid the infinity list walking.
5316 */
5317 if (sp->role.invalid)
5318 continue;
5319
5320 /*
5321 * Need not flush tlb since we only zap the sp with invalid
5322 * generation number.
5323 */
5324 if (batch >= BATCH_ZAP_PAGES &&
5325 cond_resched_lock(&kvm->mmu_lock)) {
5326 batch = 0;
5327 goto restart;
5328 }
5329
5330 ret = kvm_mmu_prepare_zap_page(kvm, sp,
5331 &kvm->arch.zapped_obsolete_pages);
5332 batch += ret;
5333
5334 if (ret)
5335 goto restart;
5336 }
5337
5338 /*
5339 * Should flush tlb before free page tables since lockless-walking
5340 * may use the pages.
5341 */
5342 kvm_mmu_commit_zap_page(kvm, &kvm->arch.zapped_obsolete_pages);
5343}
5344
5345/*
5346 * Fast invalidate all shadow pages and use lock-break technique
5347 * to zap obsolete pages.
5348 *
5349 * It's required when memslot is being deleted or VM is being
5350 * destroyed, in these cases, we should ensure that KVM MMU does
5351 * not use any resource of the being-deleted slot or all slots
5352 * after calling the function.
5353 */
5354void kvm_mmu_invalidate_zap_all_pages(struct kvm *kvm)
5355{
5356 spin_lock(&kvm->mmu_lock);
5357 trace_kvm_mmu_invalidate_zap_all_pages(kvm);
5358 kvm->arch.mmu_valid_gen++;
5359
5360 /*
5361 * Notify all vcpus to reload its shadow page table
5362 * and flush TLB. Then all vcpus will switch to new
5363 * shadow page table with the new mmu_valid_gen.
5364 *
5365 * Note: we should do this under the protection of
5366 * mmu-lock, otherwise, vcpu would purge shadow page
5367 * but miss tlb flush.
5368 */
5369 kvm_reload_remote_mmus(kvm);
5370
5371 kvm_zap_obsolete_pages(kvm);
5372 spin_unlock(&kvm->mmu_lock);
5373}
5374
5375static bool kvm_has_zapped_obsolete_pages(struct kvm *kvm)
5376{
5377 return unlikely(!list_empty_careful(&kvm->arch.zapped_obsolete_pages));
5378}
5379
5380void kvm_mmu_invalidate_mmio_sptes(struct kvm *kvm, struct kvm_memslots *slots)
5381{
5382 /*
5383 * The very rare case: if the generation-number is round,
5384 * zap all shadow pages.
5385 */
5386 if (unlikely((slots->generation & MMIO_GEN_MASK) == 0)) {
5387 kvm_debug_ratelimited("kvm: zapping shadow pages for mmio generation wraparound\n");
5388 kvm_mmu_invalidate_zap_all_pages(kvm);
5389 }
5390}
5391
5392static unsigned long
5393mmu_shrink_scan(struct shrinker *shrink, struct shrink_control *sc)
5394{
5395 struct kvm *kvm;
5396 int nr_to_scan = sc->nr_to_scan;
5397 unsigned long freed = 0;
5398
5399 spin_lock(&kvm_lock);
5400
5401 list_for_each_entry(kvm, &vm_list, vm_list) {
5402 int idx;
5403 LIST_HEAD(invalid_list);
5404
5405 /*
5406 * Never scan more than sc->nr_to_scan VM instances.
5407 * Will not hit this condition practically since we do not try
5408 * to shrink more than one VM and it is very unlikely to see
5409 * !n_used_mmu_pages so many times.
5410 */
5411 if (!nr_to_scan--)
5412 break;
5413 /*
5414 * n_used_mmu_pages is accessed without holding kvm->mmu_lock
5415 * here. We may skip a VM instance errorneosly, but we do not
5416 * want to shrink a VM that only started to populate its MMU
5417 * anyway.
5418 */
5419 if (!kvm->arch.n_used_mmu_pages &&
5420 !kvm_has_zapped_obsolete_pages(kvm))
5421 continue;
5422
5423 idx = srcu_read_lock(&kvm->srcu);
5424 spin_lock(&kvm->mmu_lock);
5425
5426 if (kvm_has_zapped_obsolete_pages(kvm)) {
5427 kvm_mmu_commit_zap_page(kvm,
5428 &kvm->arch.zapped_obsolete_pages);
5429 goto unlock;
5430 }
5431
5432 if (prepare_zap_oldest_mmu_page(kvm, &invalid_list))
5433 freed++;
5434 kvm_mmu_commit_zap_page(kvm, &invalid_list);
5435
5436unlock:
5437 spin_unlock(&kvm->mmu_lock);
5438 srcu_read_unlock(&kvm->srcu, idx);
5439
5440 /*
5441 * unfair on small ones
5442 * per-vm shrinkers cry out
5443 * sadness comes quickly
5444 */
5445 list_move_tail(&kvm->vm_list, &vm_list);
5446 break;
5447 }
5448
5449 spin_unlock(&kvm_lock);
5450 return freed;
5451}
5452
5453static unsigned long
5454mmu_shrink_count(struct shrinker *shrink, struct shrink_control *sc)
5455{
5456 return percpu_counter_read_positive(&kvm_total_used_mmu_pages);
5457}
5458
5459static struct shrinker mmu_shrinker = {
5460 .count_objects = mmu_shrink_count,
5461 .scan_objects = mmu_shrink_scan,
5462 .seeks = DEFAULT_SEEKS * 10,
5463};
5464
5465static void mmu_destroy_caches(void)
5466{
5467 if (pte_list_desc_cache)
5468 kmem_cache_destroy(pte_list_desc_cache);
5469 if (mmu_page_header_cache)
5470 kmem_cache_destroy(mmu_page_header_cache);
5471}
5472
5473int kvm_mmu_module_init(void)
5474{
5475 kvm_mmu_clear_all_pte_masks();
5476
5477 pte_list_desc_cache = kmem_cache_create("pte_list_desc",
5478 sizeof(struct pte_list_desc),
5479 0, SLAB_ACCOUNT, NULL);
5480 if (!pte_list_desc_cache)
5481 goto nomem;
5482
5483 mmu_page_header_cache = kmem_cache_create("kvm_mmu_page_header",
5484 sizeof(struct kvm_mmu_page),
5485 0, SLAB_ACCOUNT, NULL);
5486 if (!mmu_page_header_cache)
5487 goto nomem;
5488
5489 if (percpu_counter_init(&kvm_total_used_mmu_pages, 0, GFP_KERNEL))
5490 goto nomem;
5491
5492 register_shrinker(&mmu_shrinker);
5493
5494 return 0;
5495
5496nomem:
5497 mmu_destroy_caches();
5498 return -ENOMEM;
5499}
5500
5501/*
5502 * Caculate mmu pages needed for kvm.
5503 */
5504unsigned int kvm_mmu_calculate_mmu_pages(struct kvm *kvm)
5505{
5506 unsigned int nr_mmu_pages;
5507 unsigned int nr_pages = 0;
5508 struct kvm_memslots *slots;
5509 struct kvm_memory_slot *memslot;
5510 int i;
5511
5512 for (i = 0; i < KVM_ADDRESS_SPACE_NUM; i++) {
5513 slots = __kvm_memslots(kvm, i);
5514
5515 kvm_for_each_memslot(memslot, slots)
5516 nr_pages += memslot->npages;
5517 }
5518
5519 nr_mmu_pages = nr_pages * KVM_PERMILLE_MMU_PAGES / 1000;
5520 nr_mmu_pages = max(nr_mmu_pages,
5521 (unsigned int) KVM_MIN_ALLOC_MMU_PAGES);
5522
5523 return nr_mmu_pages;
5524}
5525
5526void kvm_mmu_destroy(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu)
5527{
5528 kvm_mmu_unload(vcpu);
5529 free_mmu_pages(vcpu);
5530 mmu_free_memory_caches(vcpu);
5531}
5532
5533void kvm_mmu_module_exit(void)
5534{
5535 mmu_destroy_caches();
5536 percpu_counter_destroy(&kvm_total_used_mmu_pages);
5537 unregister_shrinker(&mmu_shrinker);
5538 mmu_audit_disable();
5539}
